heading: Mismatch in a complaint on North East housing project
content: Four members of the Anti-Corruption Front informed the court through affidavits that they do not know anything about a complaint lodged by the Anti-Corruption Front against Rada Institute accusing it of malpractice at a housing project in the North and East.This was revealed when the relevant case was taken up at the Colombo High Court today (Aug 02).

heading: British MP loses party membership for making sponsored trips to Sri Lanka
content: The UK’s Democratic Unionist Party has decided to suspend MP Ian Paisley from membership pending further investigation into his conduct. Ian Paisley is now listed as an Independent MP on the British Parliament's website. The former DUP MP was suspended from the House of Commons for 30 sitting days from September 4 following the major breach of parliamentary rules. He was found to have failed to declare the holidays, that cost more than £ 50,000 and to have lobbied on behalf of the Sri Lanka government, who paid for those holidays.

heading: Strong winds hit Ampara, 76 houses damaged (Photos)
content: Unusually strong winds damaged more than 76 houses in Sammanthurai and Navagampura in the Ampara District last afternoon. Our reporters confirmed that the winds accompanied by heavy rains that hit the region. Reports state that roads have been blocked by fallen trees. The Disaster Management Centre and the District Secretariat have jointly launched a programme to provide relief to those who affected by the severe weather conditions.

heading: Mullaitivu experiences ice rain (Photos)
content: After a long spell of drought, Mullaitivu experienced rain last afternoon (Aug 02). The area residents said that pieces of ice fell in some area with rain.

heading: Hospital functions cripple due to GMOA strike
content: Our correspondents say that functions at hospitals have been affected due to a one-day token strike launched by the Government Medical Officers' Association from this morning (Aug 03).They have cited 10 reasons and the Free Trade Agreement with Singapore for their strike action.The GMOA media committee member, Dr. Prasad Colombage said that clinical and OPD services at all government hospitals are disrupted as a result of their strike.Meanwhile, the medical specialists have also joined the work stoppage and they have even moved out of private practice to show their protest against the new Inland Revenue Act.

heading: Aloysius & Palisena remanded
content: Perpetual Treasuries owner Arjun Aloysius and its CEO Kasun Palisena have been further remanded till 9th of August. The suspects who are accused of Central Bank bond scam were produced before Colombo Fort Magistrate today (Aug 02). Meanwhile, PTL's former Chief Dealer Nuwan Salgado and IT officer Sachitra Devathanthri have been arrested and granted bail.The Attorney General informed the courts that they will be state witnesses.

heading: Woman hacks man to death
content: A woman has hacked a man to death in Rukgahawatte in Mulleriyawa following a personal dispute. The incident was reported last afternoon and the reason for the murder is still unknown. The victim was a 40-year-old, a resident of Mulleriyawa. Police later arrested a woman who is accused of this murder.

heading: Mattala transfer : Minister reveals truth
content: Minister of Transport and Civil Aviation Nimal Siripala de Silva reveals that talks are held with an Indian firm to make a decision on the Mattala International Airport. The Minister De Silva revealed while responding to journalists after making an inspection visit at Ratmalana airport.

heading: Speaker seeks UPFA Gen. Sec. oppinion on Speaker
content: Speaker Karu Jayasuriya has asked the United People's Freedom Alliance's General Secretary his opinion on the request made by 8 UPFA MPs demanding to appoint Dinesh Gunawardena as the Opposition Leader.Those MPs had handed over the letter seeking MP Gunawardena be appointed as the Opposition Leader on 30th of last month.

heading: Indian drug peddler arrested at Pettah
content: Police Narcotics Bureau has arrested an Indian national in Pettah with 878g of a drug named Methamphetamine or ice. Police said that the estimated value of the detection was Rs. 10mn. The suspect, a 30-year-old from Tamil Nadu, was arrested last evening (Aug 02) and police said that he was a frequent visitor to Sri Lanka. Meanwhile, a resident of Gampaha was arrested by Customs in the Bandaranaike International Airport, while he was attempting to smuggle in Rs. 3.25 million worth of gold biscuits from Singapore. The 51-year-old suspect arrived in Sri Lanka early hours of today. An employee attached to a private cleaning firm was also arrested in connection with this case.

heading: Traffic congestion in Town Hall area
content: A traffic congestion is building up in the Town Hall area due to protest march conducted by the Joint Opposition. The march, "Janabala Sena" has been organized to protest against the government. The protest march which began at the Lipton Circus will reach Viharamahadevi Park, where they will have a rally.

heading: Prime Minister Wickremesinghe visits famous shrine in Tirumala
content: Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe offered prayers at the famous hill shrine of Lord Venkateswara in Tirumala town in India today (Aug 03). Wickremesinghe, dressed in traditional attire and accompanied by wife Maithree and a few Sri Lankan officials, visited the shrine this morning, the India media reported. On arrival, he was accorded a traditional welcome by priests and top officials of the temple, administered by the Tirumala Tirupati Devasthanams. Wickremesinghe here on a 20-hour spiritual visit, flew in from Chennai by an IAF helicopter last evening. This is his third visit as Sri Lanka's prime minister to the hill shrine after previously coming here in 2002 and 2016. Tight security arrangements were put in place in view of the visit to Tirumala hills.

heading: Rs. 77mn worth gold smuggled from Sri Lanka found in Tamil Nadu
content: India police seized 11.15 kg of gold of foreign origin that had been smuggled into Mandapam off the Vedhalai coast. The stock has been smuggled into India from Sri Lanka by sea was transporting by a bus at the time it was seized. Three suspects who were acting as couriers were arrested in Madurai yesterday. The gold, valued at 77 million rupees was found cut into different shapes and sizes. This is the largest consignment of smuggled gold found in Tamil Nadu and in November 2017, 9.2kg of gold was detected in Kondai coast in Southern India and it was smuggled from Sri Lanka.

heading: Finance Minister explains reasons to increase vehicle taxes
content: Finance Minister Mangala Samaraweera says the government was compelled to increase the import duty of vehicles less than 1000cc to contain the small vehicle usage.He said this addressing a media conference at the Finance Ministry this afternoon (Aug 02).

heading: Rising trade gap : Reason for tax hike in small cars
content: Central Bank Governor Dr. Indrajith Coomaraswamy says traffic congestion was not the only reason to increase the import tax of vehicles less than 1000 cc. Addressing the media at the Central Bank this morning, he said controlling the rising trade gap was also factored in that decision. He noted when the trade gap increases, it would also impact the debt portfolio as well as the devaluation of the rupee. In turn, he said the cost of living would also rise.

content: Hiru News - Sri Lanka’s number 1 TV news bulletin – @ 6.55 tonightThis news telecast is available live on You Tube

heading: Health alert : Vavuniya Sathosa worker accidentally mixes urea with sugar (Photos)
content: The Public Health Inspectors of Vavuniya Urban Council say that sugar stocks at the Sathosa outlet in Vavuniya have been adulterated with urea. The PHIs said this might have had happened due to the negligence of the Sathosa staff. A team of PHIs had carried out the inspection after a consumer had informed them of noticing a change in sugar he had bought from the outlet. Thereafter, the PHIs had checked the sugar sacks and found out that one of the sacks was mixed with urea. They urged the public not to use sugar bought from the Vavuniya Sathosa outlet and if they had consumed them already such people are advised to seek medical treatment as soon as possible.

heading: 11 arrested over incidents in Jaffna
content: Police have arrested 11 persons for their alleged involvements with the recent unruly incidents in Jaffna. Four motorcycles were also apprehended. The suspects were residents of Jaffna and Manipay.

heading: Court of Appeal rejects Minister Bathiutheen’s affidavit
content: The Court of Appeal has rejected an affidavit submitted by Minister Risath Bathiutheen asking to dismiss the case against him over Wilpattu deforestation.Accordingly, Court of Appeal President Justice Preethi Padman Surasena and Justice Arjuna Obeysekere ordered that the case be taken up for trial on 12th of November this year.A contempt of court case was filed before the Court of Appeal recently by attorney-at-law, Nagananda Kodituwakku alleging that the Minister had misled the judiciary with regard to the controversial deforestation in Wilpattu.The Minister also accused of promoting the illegal settlement in the Wilattikulam forest reserve of Wilpattu National Park.In the case, the Minister had submitted an affidavit citing that the Muslim community had been living in that area before they were chased away by the LTTE in 1990.However, there was no such settlement according to the Surveyor General’s report.Attorney-at-law, Kodituwakku has argued in his petition, therefore, that the Minister Bathiutheen has misled the court.

heading: Shooting in Modera, one killed
content: A 62-year-old person was killed in a shooting incident reported from Muthuwella, Modera this afternoon.Police said the victim died after he was admitted to the National Hospital, Colombo with gunshot injuries.He was shot at by two men on a motorcycle.Police said that the deceased was a father of a youth who is wanted by police for several crimes.

heading: Laos extends on arrival visa facility to Sri Lankans
content: The Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Laos has confirmed that with effect from this month Sri Lankan citizens holding valid travel documents could apply for the visa on arrival at the international border checkpoints of Laos.

heading: 130 kilos of KG found in Mannar
content: Special Task Force has arrested an individual along with 130 kilos of Kerala cannabis in Mannar. The raid was carried out following information received by the Navy Intelligence. Police said that the illegal haul was ready to be transported and the suspect has been handed over to Police Narcotics Bureau for further investigations.

heading: Office of Mullaitivu Assistant Fisheries Inspector attacked (Photos)
content: Mullaitivu Assistant Fisheries Inspector's office attacked"A group of fishermen staged a protest in Mullaitivu this morning (Aug 02), urging the authorities to ban fishing using illegal equipment and methods. Our correspondent said the protestors marched towards the Assistant Fisheries Inspector's office from the town and then staged a protest there. Police said after none of the officials came out of the office to meet the protestors, they had entered the office premises forcefully and destroyed the equipment. Later, riot control teams were called in to control the situation.

heading: Prof. Colvin Gunaratne resigns
content: Prof. Colvin Gunaratne has resigned as the President of Sri Lanka Medical Council.

heading: Tense situation erupts during Dambulla match, 10 arrested
content: Dambulla Police arrested 10 persons who behaved in an unruly manner during the ODI match between Sri Lanka and South Africa at the Dambulla International Cricket Stadium last night. Police said a security guard who was on duty at the vehicle park and UNP Central Provincial Councillor Tissa Bandara Herath who received injuries were admitted to Dambulla Hospital. The injured security guard, Chaminda Pushpakumara told us that one of the spectators attacked him with a glass bottle. Later, the riot police arrested the attacker.  Central Provincial Councilor, Tissa Bandara Herath said that he was also assaulted when he had intervened to settle the dispute.

heading: Forest fire causes damages to Northern Railway Line
content: The Northern Railway Line has damaged as a result of a forest fire that has caused by vandals. A spokesperson from the Railway Department said the forest fire had spread to the railway line where several wooden sleepers were damaged by fire. He went on to say that several used sleepers had also been destroyed in the fire. The Northern Railway Line comprises wooden sleepers from Maho to Vavuniya. Meanwhile, the Disaster Management Center stated that the number of forest fires being lit by vandals is on the increase in Badulla and Monaragala districts. 78 such fires were reported in the recent past and, 500 hectares of forest have been destroyed as a consequence. Badulla District Disaster Management Center Assistant Director, E. M. L. Udaya Kumara said that an SMS service will be launched effective today to report such fires, in an attempt to minimize damages incurred.

heading: Minister Kabir explains reason to increase vehicle tax
content: UNP chairman Kabir Hashim says that congestion on roads is the main reason behind the increase in motor vehicle tax.The Minister said this after calling on the Malwatta and Asgiri chapter chief incumbents.The Finance Ministry announced yesterday that the import duty on motor vehicles with an engine capacity not exceeding 1000 cc had been increased.Minister Kabir Hashim said that government policy had to be altered frequently based on country’s needs.

heading: More skeleton parts found from Mannar mass grave
content: Our correspondent says that more skeleton parts have been found from the mass grave in Mannar. The excavation of this grave began 46 days ago. 34 bone fragments have been handed over to the courts and more bone fragments will be handed over this week. The authorities are considering to send those bone fragments to be tested at a lab in Florida, USA.

heading: ‘Jana Bala Sena’ to be held in Colombo
content: The ‘Jana Bala Sena’ protest and the people’s rally being organized by the joint opposition in protest of the current government will be held in Colombo today (Aug 02).The Joint Opposition also said that after the protest march will begin at 2 pm from the Lipton Circus and the protest rally will be held at the Viharamahadevi Park.

heading: Police in Jaffna to curb clashes between Ava & Dhanurok groups
content: The leave of policemen attached to three police stations in Jaffna has been cancelled to assist to contain Ava and Dhanurok clashes.A senior police officer from the Northern Province confirmed that leave for personnel attached to Manipay, Kopay, and Chunnakam police stations has been cancelled.The decision has been taken in order to ensure that an adequate number of officers are on duty to assist with containing clashes in the Jaffna peninsula among the members of those gangs.In addition to that police intelligence officials have also been deployed.

heading: Ministers clash over cabinet paper to solve Railway salary anomalies
content: Reports say that a tense situation was erupted at the Cabinet meeting yesterday (Jul 31) as the opinions of Ministers Dr. Sarath Amunugama, Dr. Rajitha Senarathna and Mangala Samaraweera disputed over a special cabinet paper to rectify the salary anomalies of the railway employees.Political sources confirmed that when Minister Dr. Sarath Amunugama submitted the special cabinet paper, Finance Minister Mangala Samaraweera expressed his stern opposition to it.Minister of Health Rajitha Senarathna then expressed views supporting the cabinet paper of Minister Amunugama.The Cabinet earlier appointed a committee headed by Minister Amunugama and this special cabinet paper had been prepared based on that committee recommendations.On this occasion, Minister Samaraweera had noted that by putting forward special cabinet papers of this nature, problems could arise in other sectors as well.In spite of Minister Samaraweera voicing his opposition, the cabinet paper was approved yesterday.The railway trade unions earlier called off a planned token strike that was scheduled to be launched on Monday at midnight after Minister Amunugama assured that the issues will be resolved.

heading: Party leaders’ agree to hold Provincial Council election in January
content: At the party leaders’ meeting held yesterday, a consensus was reached to hold the provincial council election on 5th of January next year. Yesterday’s meeting was convened with Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe at the chair.When contacted, Minister Mano Ganeshan said that leaders except for the SLFP, that participated in the meeting agreed to hold the election according to the old method.At the party leaders’ meeting chaired by Speaker Karu Jayasuriya, on 20th last month, the Election Commission and Delimitation Commission Chairmen had stated that the election could be held on 5th of January next year if party leaders agreed to it.The Joint Opposition did not participate in the meeting which was held at Temple Trees last night.Joint Opposition parliamentary group leader MP Dinesh Gunawardena said that the Joint Opposition had already expressed its stance in writing.

heading: Kuwaiti couple : More videos of airport clash being published
content: More videos of the recent incident at the Bandaranaike International Airport involving a Kuwaiti couple are circulating in social media. Following the July 27th incident, five Customs officials were injured and hospitalized. It has emerged that the Kuwaiti couple had clashed with the Customs officers after they did not allow a pet dog to be taken out for failure to follow quarantine procedures. Later, the suspects were produced before Negombo Court and released on bail. However, they are banned from leaving the country.

heading: Fire at factory in Kalutara
content: A fire has broken out at a food factory in Kalutara North. Fire Brigade units from Kalutara and Horana were deployed to douse the fire. Police said that the reason for the fire is yet to be ascertained.

heading: Kopay Gramaseva Officers launch strike
content: The Gramaseva Officers in Kopay have launched a strike against the threats posed by the Ava group members. On Sunday (Jul 29), a group of persons, allegedly members of the Ava group had attacked an office of a GS officer, destroying the office equipment.

heading: STF to be deployed for search operations in prisons
content: It has been decided to deploy the Special Task Force to carry out search operations inside prisons. This was decided during a special discussion held today (Aug 01). Several high ranked officers of the STF have visited Welikada, Magazine and Colombo Remand Prison on an inspection tour. This decision has been taken to avoid illegal goods being taken to prisons.

heading: Underworld kingpin 'Pathalaye Police' handed over OCPD
content: The underworld kingpin Arunashantha Attanayake alias 'Pathalaye Police' who was arrested by the Special Task Force yesterday in Devalapola, Minuwangoda has been handed over to Organized Crimes Prevention Division. Police Media Spokesperson's office said the probe will be conducted covering several areas. Drugs such as heroin and 'ice' were also found in his possession. Recently, it was reported that this person is having close links with Minister Sarath Fonseka.

heading: NPC CM issues a warning
content: The Chief Minister of Northern Province C. V. Wigneshwaran says if the party decides to field the Chairman of Ilankai Tamil Arasu Katchi, Mavai Senathiraja as party's nominee of the Northern Province CM, he would take a decision on his political future. He said this joining HIRU TV for an interview yesterday (Jul 31).

heading: Two youths knocked down by Provincial Councillor’s vehicle, critical
content: Two youths were admitted to National Hospital, Colombo in a critical condition after their motorcycle was knocked down by a car driven by United People's Freedom Alliance's Western Provincial Councillor Jagath Angage at Mahabellana in Panadura, last night. Police said that the provincial councillor has also sustained injuries and was admitted to Panadura Hospital. The car was plying from Bandaragama to Panadura, and the motorcycle was coming from the opposite direction. The injured youths aged between 19 and 21 are residents of Poruwadanda, Horana. Police said that the motorcycle had broken into two following the accident.

heading: Special High Court issues summons to Gamini Senarath
content: The newly established three-judge bench of the Special High Court has issued summons to Chief of Staff of former President, Gamini Senerath, and three others to appear before courts on 24th of August.They are accused of misappropriating Rs. 500 million from Litro Gas, in this case.This case has been filed based on 24 charges and it will the first case to be heard by the Special High Court.

heading: Import duty of less than 1000cc cars increased
content: The Finance Ministry says that the import duty of less than 1000CC motor vehicles has been increased with effect from today (Aug 01).Meanwhile, vehicle importers say that the prices of motor vehicles less than 1000cc will increase by Rs.100000 and hybrid cars (less than 1000cc) will move up by Rs.400000 as a result of this latest duty increase.

heading: Cigarette prices increased
content: The price of a cigarette stick has increased to Rs. 5 with the upward revision of excise duty by Rs. 3.80. Accordingly, a cigarette which was sold at Rs. 50 will be sold at Rs. 55 and the price of a cigarette which was at Rs. 55 will be Rs. 60.

heading: Ministers exchange verbal volleys over railway salary issue
content: Ministers exchange verbal volleys"Reports say that a tense situation was erupted at the Cabinet meeting yesterday (Jul 31) as the opinions of Ministers Dr. Sarath Amunugama, Dr. Rajitha Senarathna and Mangala Samaraweera clashed over a special cabinet paper to rectify the salary anomalies of the railway employees. Political sources confirmed that when Minister Dr. Sarath Amunugama submitted the special cabinet paper, Finance Minister Mangala Samaraweera expressed his stern opposition to it. Minister of Health Rajitha Senarathna then expressed views supporting the cabinet paper of Minister Amunugama. The Cabinet earlier appointed a committee headed by Minister Amunugama and this special cabinet paper has been prepared based on that committee recommendations. On this occasion, Minister Samaraweera had noted that by putting forward special cabinet papers of this nature, problems could arise in other sectors as well. In spite of Minister Samaraweera voicing his opposition, the cabinet paper was approved yesterday. The railway trade unions earlier called off a planned token strike that was scheduled to be launched on Monday at midnight after Minister Amunugama assured that the issues will be resolved.

heading: Police raid a mobile brothel in Wellawatte
content: Police have carried out a raid following a tip-off in Wellawatte where a group of men had been allegedly trafficking heroin and prostitutes in a car. The incident had occurred at around 11.40 pm yesterday (Jul 31). When police were informed of the modus operandi taking place in front of a hotel in Wellawatte, a police team had arrived at the location in a jeep and a three-wheeler. Then the car, which had attempted to speed away, collided with a parapet wall, after knocking down a policeman. The injured policeman was admitted to National Hospital, Colombo. Then a policeman who was in the three-wheeler had opened fire at the car injuring the main suspect. The 39-year-old suspect, a resident of Gonapola, is now receiving treatment at National Hospital, Colombo with police protection. Investigations revealed that he was on bail over a previous court case for having heroin in his possession and running brothel houses. Police have also arrested the car driver and two other women who were inside the car.

heading: Term of Presidential Commission probing SriLankan Airlines extended
content: The term assigned to the Presidential Commission, appointed to inquire into irregularities relating to Sri Lankan Airlines, Sri Lankan Catering, and Mihin Lanka has been extended by five months. The special gazette notification issued by President Maitripala Sirisena yesterday states that the period allotted to the commission has been extended until 31st of December 2018.  The period of service of the commission was previously scheduled to end yesterday. The presidential commission had been appointed to inquire into irregularities alleged to have taken place within those companies between 1st of January, 2006 until 31st of January this year.

heading: HIRU TV's 20th anniversary : Lucky winner of 16th car from Hambantota
content: The loyal viewers of HIRU TV's Tele Perahara now have a chance to win an Rs. 2.5 million worth Mahindra e20 car on five days of the week. The 16th winner of this competition has been found and he is H. V. N. Gunatilleke from Hambantota. HIRU TV's Tele Perahara runs from 7.30 pm to 9.55 pm on weekdays. The respective winner will be chosen through an SMS competition. Several questions will be posted during teledramas, and the viewers can send the answers via SMS to HTP (space) (number sequence of the answers) (space) name, NIC number, area and send the SMS to 7766. The winner of that respective day will appear on the screen during the "Thaamath Adare Nathnam" teledrama.

heading: Sampanthan makes a statement on Opposition Leader's post
content: The Leader of Opposition R. Sampanthan gave a statement to the media today on the different opinions expressed about the post.Here, he said based on the traditions, the Speaker had made a decision on the Opposition Leader's post.Sampanthan noted that if a same party's MPs are representing both the government and the opposition, they cannot function as the official opposition in the House.

heading: Prices of more essential drugs reduced
content: Health Minister Dr. Rajitha Senaratne says that prices of another 15 essential drugs and highly priced 10 cancer drugs will be reduced with immediate effect.

heading: Finance Ministry issues circular restricting payments to excess staff at state entities
content: The Finance Ministry has issued a circular restricting payment to excess staff who had been recruited ignoring the approved service cadre at state entities. The circular was issued after the Cabinet had decided recently that it will be the responsibility of the chairmen, CEOs, and accountants of such institutions to pay the salaries of excess staff.

heading: Person who sold heroin to UK rugger players arrested
content: Police have arrested the heroin trafficker who sold drugs to the two UK rugger players who died in Sri Lanka recently. The suspect was arrested in Wellawatte. He was remanded until 10th of September after he was produced before the court.

heading: Two Navy intelligence officers remanded again
content: Two Navy intelligence officers who were granted bail yesterday over their alleged links with the disappearance of 11 youths during 2008/09 period have been remanded again. They were remanded after they had failed to fulfill the bail conditions. The relevant case was taken up before the Colombo Fort Magistrate Court today and the Attorney General's Department said that the actions that would be taken against the other suspects will be taken after scrutinizing the witness statements. After considering those submissions, magistrate Lanka Jayaratne ordered to call the case again on 25th of September.

heading: World's largest cargo plane lands at Mattala (Photos)
content: The world's largest cargo plane, Antonov ADB 2540 landed at the Mattala International Airport this afternoon (Jul 31). The plane which was flying from Indonesia to Muscat in Oman landed at the MIA for refueling at around 1.40 pm. The flight had a crew of 19.

heading: Open warrant issued against Jaliya Wickramasuriya
content: Colombo Fort Magistrates today issued an open warrant again for the arrest of former Sri Lankan ambassador to the US Jaliya Wickramasuriya. When this case was taken up before Colombo Chief Magistrate Lanka Jayaratne, the magistrate said that notices will be issued again on his wife and a relation-sister who were the sureties of the bail. The former ambassador is accused of misappropriating funds which were set aside to acquire a building for Sri Lanka's embassy in the US. The hearing was postponed to 27th of August.

heading: Elderly man jailed for abusing 5-year-old girl
content: The Colombo High Court has sentenced a 76-year-old person for a rigorous imprisonment of eight years for abusing a 5-year-old girl. High Court Judge Vikum Kaluarachchi gave the ruling against a resident of Dematagoda. The accused was imposed a fine of Rs. 20,000 and he was also ordered to pay a compensation of Rs. 50,000 to the victim. The incident had occurred in October 2009.

heading: Additional Solicitor General to examine Vijayakala’s statement
content: Attorney General, Jayantha Jayasuriya says that an additional Solicitor General has been assigned to study the ongoing investigation in connection with the pro-LTTE statement made by former State Minister, Vijayakala Maheswaran. He said the additional Solicitor General will advise and make recommendations with regard to the ongoing police investigations. Police are expected to submit a report citing progress of their probe to the Attorney General. At the same time, the Organized Crime Prevention Divison has obtained statements from MP Vijayakalaa Maheswaran and Minister Vajira Abeywardana, TNA MP Mavai Senathiraja and Northern Provincial Chief Minister, C. V. Wigneshwaran. In addition, statements have been recorded from 50 participants including the District Secretaries who were on stage at the time MP. Maheswaran made the controversial statement.

heading: 36 injured as two buses collide in Matale (Photos)
content: 36 persons including 11 school children were injured when two buses collided in Madawala on the Kandy - Jaffna main road this morning (Jul 31). The injured were admitted to Matale Hospital. The private bus was plying from Thalawakele to Dambulla while the CTB bus was heading towards Matale from Murutotuwa. The buses collided head-on and police said the condition of the two drivers is serious.

heading: Commonwealth Sec. Gen. arrives tomorrow
content: The Secretary-General of the Commonwealth Patricia Scotland will arrive in Sri Lanka tomorrow for a four-day official visit. In a statement, the Ministry of Foreign Affairs said this would be Scotland’s first visit to Sri Lanka since she assumed the Office of Secretary-General in April 2016. The main objective of the Secretary-General’s meetings will be to explore greater cooperation and collaboration in the implementation of the agreed outcomes at the 2018 Commonwealth Heads of Government Meeting (CHOGM) in London, including promoting intra-Commonwealth trade. Discussions will also include the implementation of the ‘Commonwealth Blue Charter’, under which Sri Lanka holds the role of a champion country to lead the Commonwealth effort towards the restoration of mangroves.

heading: Court allows Uduwe Dhammaloka Thera to travel abroad
content: The overseas travel ban imposed on Ven. Uduwe Dhammaloka Thera has been removed until 10th of September by Colombo High Court. The court ruling was announced after the counsels of the Thera made submissions. On 26th of this month, the Thera was asked to descend from a flight bound to London. The Thera was to visit London to attend a religious event. Ven. Uduwe Dhammaloka Thera is accused of illegally keeping an elephant calf and Thera's passport was impounded when he was granted bail.

heading: SB, Susil, and WDJ to attend JO leaders' meeting
content: Several members of the 'SLFP Group of 16' will participate in the Joint Opposition, coalition party leaders’ meeting for the first time today. The meeting will be chaired by former President Mahinda Rajapaksa at his official residence at this afternoon. MPs, S. B. Dissanayake, W. D. J. Senevirathna, and Susil Premajayantha are scheduled to participate in the meeting. The General Secretary of the Pivituru Hela Urumaya, Udaya Gammanpila said that the new constitution and provincial council election will be discussed in detail during this meeting.

heading: School vacation starts on August 3
content: All Government Sinhala and Tamil medium schools will close for vacation on 3rd of August. The Ministry of Education said that the third term will start on 3rd of September.

heading: Ranjan goes mad, behaves violently
content: Ranjan becomes mad inside elevator at Supreme Court...Deputy Minister Ranjan Ramanayake who had come to the Supreme Court to attend the Contempt of Court case against him yesterday (Jul 30) had behaved in an unruly manner at the elevator of the Superior Court Complex in Colombo. Because of his unruly behaviour, two female attorneys-at-law who were in the elevator to go to the courtrooms 403 and 502 had got down from the elevator at the next floor. The court staffer who was operating the elevator had said that he will lodge a complaint with the marshal who is looking after the security at the Superior Court Complex on this incident. It was reported that Ranjan Ramanayake while going to the 5th floor of the court complex, after entering the elevator with few of others, had acted in an unruly manner hitting the iron-plated walls of the elevator with his elbow. Then after the case was heard, while returning to the 2nd floor, Ramanayake had acted more violently, hitting the iron-plated walls furiously. After coming out of the elevator, he had asked the operator "Are you well now and happy" ("Dan saneepada, hugak sathutuda" and then left.

heading: Rangajeewa & Lamahewa further remanded
content: IP Neomal Rangajeewa and former Prisons Commissioner Emil Ranjan Lamahewa have been further remanded till 7th of August. They are in custody after they were arrested over 2012 prison riots, where 27 prison inmates were killed.

heading: Protestors block Matara - Walasmulla road (Photos)
content: The traffic on the Matara - Walasmulla road via Hakmana has been stalled due to a protest. The protestors urged the authorities to renovate the Aththudawa road.       (

heading: Three Facebook friends arrested over fire of ‘Lovers Mountain ’
content: Three persons were arrested in connection the arson of Nearthegala Kanda in Ratnapura also known as ‘Lovers Mountain ’.The Disaster Management Centre said that the fire erupted yesterday and has since been doused.More than 300 acres were destroyed.Disaster Management Centre’s Assistant Director Pradeep Kodippili said that three friends had coordinated a trip to the mountain, via Facebook.It was found that the fire was erupted as a result of negligence by the group when they were lighting a campfire.Later they were arrested by police for causing the fire.

heading: Party leaders meet to discuss 20 A
content: A special party leaders’ meeting with the Speaker at the chair is scheduled to be held at the parliament complex today. Political sources say that discussions will focus on the 20th constitutional amendment and the parliamentary session scheduled to begin on 7th of August. Following today’s party leaders’ meeting, another party leaders’ meeting has been scheduled for tomorrow with the Prime Minister at the chair.

heading: Doctors’ DAT allowance increased, GMOA says token strike will go ahead
content: The Treasury has approved an increase in the DAT payment, which is the Obstacle and Attendance Transport Allowance granted to doctors. The allowance will be increased by Rs. 15,000 for a general practitioner and Rs. 25,000 for a specialist doctor. The Finance Ministry said that at present all government doctors receive Rs. 35,000 as DAT allowance. The Management Services Department had recently requested recommendations from the Treasury to increase the allowance. However, the Government Medical Officers’ Association says that the island-wide token strike to be launched on 3rd of August will go ahead as scheduled.

heading: Mars gets closer to earth after 15 years
content: Mars will be at its closest distance to Earth in 15 years tonight (Jul 31), wrapping up a memorable month for stargazers. And we may never see the Red Planet so near for another 269 years. The Red Planet will be 57.6 million kilometers from the earth, offering the clearest and brightest views since 2003. The local stargazers are invited for a camp to witness the Red Planet from 7 pm to 10 pm tonight at the Colombo Campus grounds.

heading: Gov. to introduce an insurance scheme for monks
content: COLOMBO (News 1st) – The Government has decided to introduce an insurance scheme for Buddhist monks.Minister of Buddha Shasana Gamini Jayawickrama Perera said that the relevant proposal has been handed over to the Cabinet for approval.The Minister added that monks who study at Pirivenas and are state employees will not be included in this insurance scheme.

heading: The 10bn People's Bank loan is being investigated
content: Colombo (News1st) – Over the past few days, News1st has been reporting on a Rs 10bn loan granted by People’s Bank to MTD Walkers PLC. The loan is special not only because it is the largest loan issued by the bank in its history but also because Jehan Amaratunge who sits on the People’s bank board of Directors also holds the position of Executive Deputy Chairman of MTD Walkers PLC.Senior Banker Rusiripala Tennakoon joining News1st for a special interview noted that Jehan Amaratunge has been serving as a member of the People’s bank, board of directors since 2010. He noted that it is very rare to see an individual continuing to serve for a long period of time especially in a backdrop where there was a change in Government.Tennakoon revealed that any related party transactions undertaken by a banking institution needs to be referred to an audit committee of the same bank. The senior banker also revealed that Amaratunge serves as the Chairman of the Audit Committee of People’s bank and that this itself is unethical.A MINISTERIAL EXPLANATIONThe matter relating to the Rs 10bn loan was raised during a media briefing in Colombo today. Journalists questioned whether Minister of Finance Mangala Samaraweera is aware of such a loan being granted.However, it was State Minister of Finance, Eran Wickremeratne who jumped at the opportunity to respond to the query. The State Minister noted that matters relating to loans are controlled by the management of the relevant bank and that ministers do not intervene in any shape or form in the decision-making process. He requested the journalists to pose this question to the bank itself.Minister Mangala Samaraweera explained that the banking sector does not fall under the purview of the Ministry of Finance. He noted that the subject minister in charge of banks is currently Lakshman Kiriella.Journalists then questioned the minister on whether obtaining such a loan was ethical? State Minister Wickremeratne responded by stating that there was a conflict of interest in this particular instance.A CONFLICT OF INTERESTMano Thittawella who is an adviser to the Ministry of Finance also arrived at the media briefing and journalists questioned him regarding the issue surrounding ETI Finance. It was Min. Mangala Samaraweera who responded to the journalists by stating that Thittawella was present at the location in his capacity as an advisor and requested the journalists to question him on ETI after the event. Min. Samaraweera was confident enough to say that his advisor would respond to the media after the event, unfortunately, Tittawella refused to comment on the record following the event.Minister Mangala Samaraweera and State Minister Eran Wickremeratne spoke about conflict of interest at the media briefing.Isn’t it a conflict of interest when the person who was the chairman and managing director of the EAP group to which ETI Finance belongs is now functioning as an advisor to the Ministry of Finance. Mano Thittawella also functions as a board member at Sri Lankan Airlines as well as the Secretary General of the Secretariat for Coordinating Reconciliation Mechanisms. During former governments, Mano Tittawella has held several key positions.Minister Malik Samarawickreme held an inspection tour of the construction of a Tyre factory in Horana recently along with Nandana Lokuvithana who is allegedly involved in financial misappropriation during the previous government. Lokuvithana is the current owner of Speville Ceylon of which Minister Malik Samarawickreme was functioning as a director in the past.Jehan Amaratunga who has obtained a loan of Rs. 10bn from the People’s Bank for his company has taken his post as director of the People’s Bank during the last government in the year 2010. All these individuals are working well to make sure that their objectives are reached.One could very well say that there seems to be no difference between the people that were in power before and the people in power today.In this myriad of depressing reports, there is a bright light, although it does come from the unlikeliest of persons.PROMISE OF AN INVESTIGATIONMinister of Public Enterprise Lakshman Kiriella speaking to News1st today noted that he has called for an immediate investigation into the Rs. 10bn loan granted by People’s bank.While stating that he got to know of this issue through the media the Minister noted that he had instructed his Ministry Secretary and the Chairman of the People’s bank to conduct an immediate inquiry and report back to him.We must praise this good measure taken by the Minister, which comes after a long time. Time will tell if this is just another empty promise made by another politician.

heading: Pibidemu Polonnaruwa projects vested in the public
content: COLOMBO (News 1st) – Several more projects completed under the Pibidemu Polonnaruwa District Development Programme, were vested with the public on Thursday (August 02).The day began with President Maithripala Sirisena opening a walking path that was constructed at a cost of Rs. 5.52mn. He later traveled to Royal College, Polonnaruwa to declared open a cricket ground which was built at a cost of Rs 250mn.  The President also distributed cricket equipment for 4 schools in the district including the Sevanapitiya Maha Vidyalaya.The Aralaganwila Kidney Disease Prevention Unit, Aralaganwila Zonal Education Office and a three-story building comprising of 36 classrooms built at a cost of Rs. 63.75 million at the Aralaganwila Central College, were all declared open by the President on Thursday.

heading: Politicos cry foul at Malik's Singapore land deal
content: COLOMBO (News 1st) – UPFA Parliamentarian, Kanchana Wijesekera states that a couple of months ago, Minister Malik Samarawickrema brought an amazing proposal to the Cabinet. He stated that it was an amendment proposal for a mixed development project on a state-owned land, located down Baladaksha Mawatha between the Beira Lake and the Shangri La Hotel, which was to be implemented by Perennial Real Estate Holdings Limited.MP Kanchana Wijesekara states that this proposal was among the land acts presented last week. According to him, this aim of this act was to provide the ownership of this land to the Singaporean company Perennial Real Estate Holdings Limited. MP Kanchana goes on to state that, the state valuation for this land is Rs 12.5 mn per perch. The Parliamentarian notes that if the Government calls for tenders to lease out this land, they would be able to get a better price.Commenting on the same matter; Leader of the National Unity Alliance Party, Azath Salley states that Perennial Real Estate Holdings Limited which is a Singaporean owned company, is requesting for another piece of land behind Shangri-La. He further explained that no one knows who the owner of this company is, except for Mano Thiththawella and Malik Samarawickrama.He said that his main concern was with regards to whose money is being invested in these projects? Salley questioned whether the money coming into the country was black money which was pumped out of the country.Azath Salley further explained that individuals come into Sri Lanka not only as investors, but also occupies positions in Malik Samarawickrama’s Private Companies.Elaborating further MP Azath Salley stated that the Singapore-Sri Lanka Trade Agreement is being criticized by everyone. He notes that the Trade Agreement bill was supposed to be sent back to the cabinet for further ratification but it was not. Azath Salley further states that when Min Malik was questioned regarding this matter, he has not clarified the matter. Ending the comment he states that they feel 174 papers of the agreement are missing and there’s nobody to assume responsibility in this matter.

heading: Testimony against Tiran Alles false
content: COLOMBO (News 1st) – President’s Counsel Nalin Ladduwahetti stated in courts today (August 02) that Nishantha Sri Warnasinghe had provided false testimony in the case against former member of Parliament Tiran Alles and four others accused of misappropriating Rs. 200 million.PC Ladduwahetti had presented four affidavits stating that the testimony by Warnasinghe on the Venerable Akmeemana Dayarathana Thero, Venerable Ulapane Sumangala Thero, Keerthi Thennakon and Maithri Gunarathne are all false.Nishantha Sri Warnasinghe testified to the discussion conducted between Maithri Gunarathne, Keerthi Thennakon and Venerable Ulapane Sumangala thero on handing over the relevant documents to the IGP after analysing them.However today, the individuals who submitted affidavits stated that this was not true. The trial date to admit evidence in court has been postponed to the 4th of October.

heading: Aloysisus & Palisena remanded till the 9th of Aug.
content: COLOMBO (News 1st) – Beneficial owner of Perpetual Treasuries Ltd. Arjun Aloysius and its’ CEO Kasun Palisena have been further remanded till the 09th of August after being produced before Fort Magistrate Lanka Jayaratne.Meanwhile, two former officials of the Perpetual Treasuries, Nuwan Salgado, and Sachithra Devathanthri were taken into custody as they were unable to produce their passport to courts in accordance with their bail conditions.Nuwan Salgado and Sachithra Devathanthri were arrested by the Criminal Investigation Department this morning on charges for erasing evidence of recorded phone calls that had been made during the period of the bond scam.Upon being presented to the Fort Magistrate Lanka Jayaratne the two individuals had been granted bail. Bail was set at Rs 300,000 each and several other conditions were also imposed.

heading: Myanmar scales back plan for Chinese backed port
content: COLOMBO (News 1st) – Myanmar has scaled back plans for a Chinese-backed port on its western coast, sharply reducing the cost of the project after concerns it could leave the Southeast Asian nation heavily indebted. A top government official and an advisor told Reuters the initial 7.3 billion US Dollar price tag on the port, set off alarm bells due to reports of troubled Chinese-backed projects in Sri Lanka and Pakistan.The Kyauk Pyu deepwater port is being constructed on the western tip of Myanmar’s conflict-torn Rakhine state. Deputy Finance Minister Set Aung, who was appointed to lead project negotiations in May, told Reuters the “project size has been tremendously scaled down”.The Deputy Minister said the revised cost would be “around 1.3 billion Dollars, something that’s much more plausible for Myanmar’s use”. China’s state-run CITIC Group, the main developer of the project, said negotiations were ongoing and that the 1.3 billion Dollars was to be spent on the “initial phase” of the port, adding the project was divided into four phases.The Kyauk Pyu port is a key part of China’s ambitious Belt and Road initiative, aimed at expanding trade links across the world. Kyauk Pyu is an entry point for a 770-kilometre pipeline delivering oil and natural gas to China’s Yunnan province.That gives China an alternative route for energy imports from the Middle East that avoids the strategic chokepoint of the Malacca Strait. Construction on the port, and an accompanying special economic zone, which together were supposed to cost up to US$10 billion, was expected to start in 2018.But Myanmar officials said the experience of Sri Lanka, where this year the government signed over to China the lease on a strategic port to pay off Chinese-backed loans used to finance it, had raised concerns the country could be walking into a debt trap.The deputy finance minister of Myanmar said his country would give no sovereign guarantees for any loans financing the project.

heading: 7 suspects connected to thefts arrested
content: COLOMBO (News 1st) – Seven people connected to several thefts in Hambantota and Ambalantota have been arrested. The arrests had been made by officers attached to the Tangalle Police.Six suspects were arrested on charges of robbing materials worth over Rs. 37,500 from a steel workshop in Ambalanthota and robbing property worth over Rs.1.5 million from a construction site of the Hambanthota expressway.The seventh suspect was arrested for robbing 2 gold chains in Ambalanthota. All seven suspects are to be produced before the Hambantota Magistrate’s Court today (August 2).

COLOMBO (News 1st) – A suspect was arrested on the Oluthoduwai coast in Mannar for possession of 130 kilograms of Kerala Ganja.A spokesperson for the police stated that the Police STF had carried out the raid according to a tip-off received by the SL Navy.The Kerala Ganja worth Rs. 6.5mn had been found hidden in four sacks. The suspect has been identified as a 39-year-old resident from Mannar.The suspect is due to be presented before the Mannar magistrate’s court.

heading: New Zealand student visa scam in Sri Lanka
content: COLOMBO (News 1st) – Immigration officers in New Zealand have been forced to review more than 800 student visa applications from Sri Lanka after uncovering a scam.Foreign media reported that it was uncovered that students applying to go to New Zealand would use a finance company willing to claim they had enough money to support themselves.It was revealed that New Zealand immigration officials had first uncovered the racket in January this year.

heading: Avant-Garde Armoury suspects released on Bail
content: Colombo (News 1st) – The Operational Manager, Millaniyage Sumudu Nilupul Kosta and the Store Manager of the armoury, Thomas Albert Wijetunge Thilakaratne of Avant-Garde Floating Armoury were released on bail yesterday by Judge Manjula Thilakaratne in the Galle High court today. The bail was set at LKR 500,000 and a Personal Recognizance bail amounting to LKR 2,500,000 for each individual with a restriction on international travel.As a condition of the bail, the two suspects must present themselves to the Criminal Investigation Department on the last Sunday of every month.On October 13, 2015, the Sri Lankan Navy confiscated the Avant-Garde Floating Armoury which held illegal weapons and explosives that included 549 T56 guns, 264 Norinco 84S guns with 204,674 bullets and 2 L.M.G guns.Investigations are ongoing by the CID.

heading: SLPP takes umbrage over CMC Opposition Leader
content: COLOMBO (News 1st) – A group of SLPP Colombo Municipal Councillors have threatened to take legal action against the council over the position of CMC Opposition Leader.M. Manzil of the UPFA assumed duties as the Opposition leader of the CMC on Wednesday (August 1st) , the SLPP councillors expressed their opposition by walking out the chamber. They later held a media briefing opposite the Colombo Municipal Council.SLPP Councillor of the SLPP, Dayakantha Perera stated that Mayor Rosy Senanayake is attempting to replicate the situation in Parliament, where R. Sampanthan has been appointed as the opposition leader. Perera claims that this allows the Government to continue with their actions unhindered. Perera added that the CMC Mayor appointed the Manzil as the Oppositiion leader for the same purpose.

heading: Election spending to be capped through new bill
content: COLOMBO (News 1st) – A draft bill to cap election spending has been presented to the National Elections Commission from the Legal Draftsman’s Department.The premise of the draft bill has been considered first by the elections commission, taking into account the recommendations of political parties, election observers, and civil society.Following the approval of the Cabinet, the Legal Draftsman’s Department has assembled the bill.  As per the new draft bill, all election-related expenses must be borne by the candidates themselves. Stemming from the bill, it suggests that two accounts; one in the name of the candidate and another in the name of the party, must be created upon receiving nominations. All relevant income and expenses are expected to flow through these accounts.The draft bill also contains further recommendations on steps to be followed to conduct a free and fair election.Legal Director of the national elections commission Nimal Punchihewa stated that the draft bill will be resubmitted Legal Draftsman’s Department with amendments within two weeks. The bill will then be forwarded to the Secretary to the President and later to the Prime Ministers Secretariat in order to be submitted to the Parliament for approval.

heading: Colvin Gunaratne steps down as Chairman of SLMC
content: COLOMBO (News 1st) – Professor Colvin Gunaratne has stepped down from the position of Chairman of the Sri Lankan Medical Council.A spokesperson for the Health Ministry stated that he had submitted his letter of resignation this morning (August 02) to Health Minister Rajitha Senarathne.Professor Colvin Gunaratne took up office as the Chairman of the Sri Lankan Medical Council in October 2017.

heading: GMOA launches 24 hour trade union action
content: COLOMBO (News 1st) – The Government Medical Officers’ Association (GMOA) has launched a 24-hour trade union action citing 10 issues including the Sri Lanka Singapore free Trade agreement. The trade union action commenced at 8am.Dr. Samantha Ananda, media spokesperson of the GMOA  noted that the trade union action will not affect emergency services.Meanwhile, the Association of Medical Specialists says it will refrain from all private medical services today (August 3). Chairman of the Association Dr. S.R. Wijeyasinghe said the strike will be carried out against the high tax percentage imposed on Professionals including specialist doctors through the new Inland Revenu Act.

heading: Nimal Siripala unveil plans for Rathmalana Airport
content: COLOMBO (News 1st) – The Government aims to launch a project to develop the Ratmalana Airport as an International Airport and for the existing Sri Lankan Air Force Base and its operations to be moved elsewhere.While this project further upgrades the airport system of Sri Lanka, the Bandaranaike International Airport situated in the suburbs of Negombo is a fully functioning and well-equipped airport which serves it’s purpose. While the aim of refurbishing the Ratmalana Airport is well intended for sure, it is quite dubious on whether Sri Lanka has an urgent need for ‘another’ international airport.The Katunayake airport is undergoing resurfacing of its runway. According to Airport and Aviation Services (Sri Lanka) Limited, future projects planned for the Katunayake airport, include a second runway to support the Airbus A380, a further eight passenger gates, a domestic terminal, a five-storeyed car-park, and a five-star hotel neighbouring the airport.With all the refurbishments to the Katunayake Airport included, it is a fair question to be raised as to why Sri Lanka plans to invest in upgrading the Ratmalana Domestic airbase, given the current economy and debt situation of the country.LEARNING FROM PAST MISTAKESIf we recall, the Good Governance Government came into power to rectify certain unaccounted decisions made by the previous regime. This includes the unwarranted construction of the Mattala airport, which is reported to be the World’s emptiest airport. Given the circumstances, it is questionable whether the current administration has learned anything from the mistakes of the past administration.Minister of Transport and Civil Aviation, Nimal Siripala De Silva was questioned at a press conference, whether the refurbishment of the Ratmalana airbase is an attempt to sell off the airport, like the Government’s plans for the Mattala airport. Min. Nimal Siripala seemed a bit agitated by the question as he fired back rhetorical questions at the journalists. He stated emphatically that there is no idea of selling the Ratmalana airport or the Mattala Airport.In a speech given at the parliament on 6 June 2018, Min. Nimal Siripala, speaking on the Mattala airport, states that a project plan was put forward by the Indian Airport Authority, to be initiated as a Joint Venture. He states that the discussion was on establishing a separate controlling legal entity (Private company) by the Sri Lankan Government and the Indian Airport Authority, where the Indian Authority plans to buy 70% of the shares of the newly established company. According to Min. Nimal Siripala the discussions with India are ongoing and the parties haven’t reached a decision yet. He also reassures that the 70% equity investment by the Indian Airport Authority could be used in servicing the debt of the country.However, claims that the Indian Airport Authority was interested in the Mattala airport was rejected by the Indian Minister of State for Civil Aviation in the Lok Sabha recently.ANOTHER WHITE-ELEPHANT?A rational question that arises is where Sri Lanka would find the funds necessary to develop the Rathmalana airport, is it through another loan or through some Government fund. Either way is this really how the Government should invest this money given the current situation of the economy and the cost of living?The question is will the Rathmala Airport become the Good Governance Government’s Mattala.

heading: Rs 10,000 compensation for Amapara victims
content: COLOMBO (News 1st) – The number of houses damaged by strong winds in Ampara has risen to 217 and 3 houses have been destroyed. The spokesperson for the Ministry of Power and Renewable Energy, Sulakshana Jayawardena, said the winds have resulted in the disruption of electricity to an estimated 5000 homes and efforts are underway to restore the supply of electricity.Ampara District Secretary Thusitha P.Wanigasinghe said houses in Nawagampura, Saddathissapura, Jayawardenapura, and Karangawa have been affected by strong winds.Assistant Director of the Disaster Management Centre Pradeep Kodippili said compensation of Rs. 10,000 will be paid to those affected by the winds.

heading: Moves afoot to appoint Dinesh as Opposition Leader
content: COLOMBO (News 1st) – General Secretary of the United People’s Freedom Alliance (UPFA) Minister Mahinda Amaraweera said today a final decision with regard to the post of Leader of the Opposition will be reached after holding discussions with the senior members of the UPFA. Amaraweera confirmed that the UPFA has received a letter from Speaker Karu Jayasuriya inquiring about UPFA position on the appointment of parliamentary stalwart Dinesh Gunawardena.Minister Amaraweera stated the party is scheduled to meet and would arrive at a decision after discussing the possible appointment.In a communique, the Speaker’s office stated that the letter requesting the appointment of Gunawardena as opposition leader bearing the signatures of eight MPs was submitted to the Speaker on the 30th of July.

heading: Accusation levelled against Min Malik on FTA
content: COLOMBO (News 1st) – The Association of IT Professionals convened a press briefing in Colombo regarding the Sri Lanka-Singapore Free Trade Agreement (FTA).The Secretary of the Association of IT professionals, Lasantha Wickremasinghe stated that it appears Malik Samarawikrama is not versed on the agreement and that they themselves showed the Minister the clause regarding manpower.Of all those ministers who attack professionals through the media, they are unaware of these things and are waiting to raise hands against Minister Malik Samarawickrama when he presents something to the cabinet. Wickremasinghe continued to say that they are confident that Minister Harin Fernando is not well-informed on the topic of Information Technology and the only thing that they say is that this deal will bring in investors.Chairman of the Association of IT Professionals Kapila Perera stated that the situation is more dangerous than an actual loss and that they have signed such deals, but only for goods which mostly turned out with losses.Perera added that although Malik Samarawikrama spoke of this in Parliament, he didn’t know the basics of this agreement and in future, they may have to come to court because 6 or 7 groups will file fundamental right petitions.

heading: Indian arrested with 'ICE' worth over Rs. 10 Mn
content: COLOMBO (News 1st) – An Indian national was arrested in Fort, Colombo for the possession of 870 grams of Ice also known as Crystal Meth.According to the Police media unit, the arrest was made during a raid carried out by the Police Narcotics Bureau.The confiscated stock of drugs is worth over Rs. 10mn. The 30-year-old suspect is to be produced before the court today (August 03).

heading: Villagers request assistance to get clean water
content: COLOMBO (News 1st) – Over 650 families that live in Nikagolla, Matale are facing serious difficulties due to the lack of clean drinking water.According to the villagers in the area, it is difficult to provide water to the village due to its location.Instead of waiting for the authorities to provide all the answers, the villagers got together and dug a 50-foot deep tube well.However, due to the lack of resources, the area residents have been stuck in their efforts. They now require assistance from the proper authorities to build a water tower and lay down pipes to supply this water to the village.

heading: On arrival visas for Sri Lankans flying to Laos
content: COLOMBO (News 1st) – The Government of the Lao People’s Democratic Republic (Laos), has taken a decision to grant on arrival visas for Sri Lankan nationals with valid passports.According to a release issued by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, the on arrival visa facility for Sri Lankans was available from the 1st of August.The Ministry of Foreign Affairs notes that the opportunity has been granted by Laos for Sri Lankan tourists due to enhanced diplomatic relations between the two countries

heading: Country before self or vice versa?
content: COLOMBO (News 1st) – Since the current administration was elected to power there have been a plethora of taxes imposed on the general public. The cost of living is on the rise and it seems that this unbearable cost of living is beginning to take a toll on our elected public representatives as well.It could be because of this very reason that they are planning on giving themselves a pay rise, as a pat on the back for the hard work that they have put in to improve the state of the country over the past 3 years. Several newspapers reported on Thursday (Aug. 2nd) quoting parliamentary sources that our public representatives stand to benefit from a whopping 215% pay increase.How will the Government pass such a proposal through Parliament? By simply ensuring that this pay increase benefits everyone across the board. Yes! the proposal seeks to increase the salaries of Ministers, Deputy Ministers, State Ministers and Parliamentarians, thus ensuring bipartisan support in Parliament which is rarely seen in any matter of national concern.The media reports indicate that the proposal to increase the salaries came up for discussion during the party leaders meeting held on the 17th of July. The reports add that the salary increment would be retrospectively applied from January this year and that it would be paid this month with the arrears.CRUNCHING THE NUMBERSThe current salary of a member of Parliament is Rs.54,285. If this proposed salary increment does come into play MPs will see their monthly salary rise to Rs.120, 000.The monthly salary of a Deputy Minister is set to increase from Rs.63,500 to Rs 135,000, while the salaries drawn by Ministers and State Ministers would increase from Rs.65,000 to Rs.140,000.In addition to all this, since 2016 each and every member of Parliament receives a Rs 100,000 office allowance and a Rs. 50,000 phone allowance. Not forgetting the myriad of perks and benefits enjoyed by those in the Government.It is not surprising that the move to increase the salaries of members of Parliament has been met with outrage by the members of the general public who are requested to tighten their belts because of the enormous debt burden that the current government says it has to deal with, at every possible occasion.GOOD GOVERNANCEMinister of Home Affairs Vajira Abeywardene attended an event in Kegalle today and as he was leaving the location of the event, he was questioned by Journalists. The question that was posed was simple “how fair is it to increase salaries by 215% when the economy is in such a state.” The Minister no doubt shocked and taken aback by the report that he stands to receive a pay rise, simply walked away smiling with his index finger pressed to his lips, as if to say shhh! don’t jinx it.Former Minister Mahindananda Aluthgamage speaking to the media noted that it is unfair to increase the salaries of Parliamentarians in a backdrop where taxes imposed on the general public keeps rising.Addressing a media briefing General Secretary of the United National Freedom Front, Maithri Gunratne questioned if this is what the current administration classifies as “good governance.” Gunaratne spoke about the actions of Dr. Mahathir Mohammad, the Prime Minister of Malaysia, who proposed a 20% pay cut for all parliamentarians taking into consideration the status of the economy. He noted that the situation in Sri Lanka is completely different.Minister of Finance and Mass Media Mangala Samaraweera was also questioned by the media on Thursday (Aug 2nd) on the reports of a possible salary increase for MPs. Minister Samaraweera noted that personally, he is against the salaries of anyone being increased at this current point of time. He noted that whatever discussions are held, the final decision has to come through him.It is admirable that the Minister of Finance feels this way in a personal capacity, however, can he withstand pressure from his peers and superiors when the time comes to make the crucial decision. Will it be country before self or vice versa?
