heading: Two gold smugglers arrested at BIA
content: COLOMBO (News 1st) – Two suspects were arrested by Customs officials at the Bandaranayake International Airport for the possession of five Gold biscuits.Deputy Customs Director Vipula Minuwanpitiya said the duo who arrived from Singapore had attempted to smuggle the stock of gold weighing 500 grams into the country.The customs department is conducting further investigations.

heading: People's Bank issues explanation on 10bn loan
content: Colombo (News1st) – The People’s Bank has provided a clarification regarding the transactions that had transpired between the bank and MTD Walkers PLC.This clarification has been provided on details that were revealed by former senior banker Rusiripala Tennakone regarding the Peoples Bank Purchasing debentures of MTD Walkers as well as a loan being classified as a Non-Performing Loan.The letter signed by the chairman of the People’s Bank Hemasiri Fernando says the loan obtained by MTD Walkers PLC is at present considered to be a performing loan. The letter says that as a step to reduce the risk while carrying out daily business activities, banks offer various loans and it invests in the stock market, treasury bonds and treasury bills as well as on debentures.The letter reads the People’s Bank invested 500 million rupees in debentures in 2015 issued by MTD Walkers PLC at an interest rate of 9.75 percent. As per the letter, the approval had been granted after the earning ratio of the investors were compared.The  People’s Bank says the interest rate at which loans would be granted to other parties usually stood at 13.11% at the time this investment was done. The letter says, after paying income tax the net interest rate of the bank stood at 9.44 percent and the interest rate for treasury bonds and treasury bills stood at 7.08%. The letter goes onto note that since income tax is exempted on interest income received by debentures, the bank had received more benefits.Rusiripala Tennakone meanwhile notes that the finances of the People’s Bank is not so weak as to warrant an investment in debentures from a company which is being closely scrutinized by the Colombo Stock Exchange. He questions, as to why money was invested in debentures of this company when there were several other options, where a high-interest rate could be earned or a higher income could be earned. He questions whether this transaction was prompted by an individual who was both a part of the People’s Bank and MTD Walkers PLC

heading: Shanthi Bhagirathan among Asia's Top Women Leaders
content: COLOMBO (News 1st) – Shanthi Bhagirathan, Group Director of The Capital Maharaja Organization Limited, received Asia’s Top Women Leadership Award at an awards ceremony in Singapore on Wednesday (August 01).The awards, hosted by CMO Asia which is represented by over 110 countries, was held at Le Méridien Singapore, Sentosa. The award is affiliated to the Asia Chapter of the World Women Leadership Congress.Shanthi Bhagirathan, Group Director of MTV/MBC Networks Pvt Ltd., a subsidiary of The Capital Maharaja Organization Limited(TCMOL), was among Asia’s top 25 Women Leaders recognized by the awards.Group Director of The Capital Maharaja Organization Limited, Shanthi Bhagirathan speaking to News 1st said;“It is for recognizing visionary leadership at media, empowerment, social chain, gender specialized specific work, ability to influence and opportunities taken. I’m indeed humbled to be named among the top 25 women leaders in Asia. This encourages me to strive to bring more for the industry, my company, and my country while raising the bar for what women can achieve in a highly demanding career. My sincere gratitude to Chairman Mr. Rajamahendran for giving me this opportunity, guiding me over the years. I thank my colleagues at the MBC/MTV media. What I’m today is what I have learned from The Capital Maharaja Organization. I will dedicate this honor to my Chairman Mr. Rajamahendran. And I like to quote ‘Nothing is impossible, the word itself says I am possible'”.

heading: Calls intensify for investigation on 2nd bond scam
content: COLOMBO (News 1st) – The middle-income earners of this country dream of one day having a vehicle of their own – but it appears that dream is fading away gradually. Prices of goods increase by the day while the rupee depreciated to a record low in the not too distant past, not forgetting that interest rates increased by 03% as well.Isn’t the looting of public funds from the Central Bank Treasury Bond Scam the main reason for these aggravating issue that burden the general public?The immediate loss from the 1st Bond Issue dated the 27th of February 2015 was estimated by the Auditor General as over Rs. 896 Million. It now stated that by the end of the maturity period of 30 years for this bond, the loss to the state will be in the Billions and could even reach the level of Trillions of rupees.The most dangerous aspect of this Bond Scam is that those involved had tampered with the Employees Provident Fund. The EPF is where the working masses deposit a portion of their hard earned monthly salary – shedding blood, sweat, and tears for many years. Sadly, the money which the people hope of taking back when they reach retirement too had been looted from this scam and its reach is such that it had forced taxes to be imposed on the remainder of the fund.The loss caused by the first bond scam has been revealed thus far. However, while the investigations on the bond scam took place, in 2016 another bond scam took place, and loss caused by this is far greater than the first.Speaking to the media the Executive director of the CaFFE Keerthi Tennakoon said it is clear that the information relating to the Second Bond Scam was limited when it was inquired by the Presidential Commission of Inquiry. He said it must be made clear that the financial fraud of over Rs. 11 Billion is only connected to the first bond scam.Keerthi Tennakoon added that they are attempting to state the total loss of around Rs. 12 Billion and there is no truth to this, it has affected the funds of the Unversity Grants Commission, the Mahapola, Central Bank Funds, the EPF, the ETF, the National Saving Bank, the People’s Bank as well as the Insurance Corporation. The total loss from this scam is Rs. 32 BIllion Rupees or even more, said Keerthi Tennakoon adding that investigations must take place with regard to this second bond scam.

heading: Nagananda seeks clarification from AG
content: COLOMBO (News 1st) – Attorney-at-Law Nagananda Kodituwakku has expressed his displeasure on the delay of implementing of the recommendations of the Presidential Commission on the Inquiry that inquired into the issuance of Treasury Bonds.In a letter addressed to the Attorney General, Attorney-at-Law Nagananda Kodituwakku says if legal measures in this regard are not taken within 7 days, a case will be filed against the Attorney General in the Court of Appeal.In his letter, Nagananda Kodituwakku states, following the details revealed during investigations on the Bond Scam, the Attorney General has evaded his duty of taking legal action against the criminals involved in the scam.

heading: President launches Polonnaruwa development drive
content: Colombo (News1st) – Several development projects in the Polonnaruwa district were vested in the public on Wednesday under the auspices of President Maithripala Sirisena.The inauguration of the “Pibidemu Polonnaruwa” or Awakening of Polonnaruwa, district development programme was held at the Diwulankadawala Central College this morning. The two-storey bulding which was constructed at a cost of 160 million rupees was declared open by President Maithripala Sirisena.Addressing the occasion President Maithripala Sirisena explained that they identified several key areas that they would focus on through this development program. The first among them was the education while the other areas of focus were identified as health, agriculture and infrastructure development.  He noted that development programs of this nature would be launched in all other districts as well and that the politicians in those areas would be tasked with identifying the priorities in each district.The Medirigiriya bus stop, the administrative building of the Sirimavo Bandaranaike Primary School in Medirigiriya, the Irrigation Management Office in Medirigiriya and the new three-storey building of the Medirigiriya National School were all declared open by the President on Wednesday.President Sirisena also distributed mango plants among students of the Medirigiriya National School to symbolize the tree planting programme implemented near schools in the Polonnaruwa District parallel to the Pibidemu Polonnaruwa programme.

heading: When will rural roads in Kandy be developed?
content: Colombo (News 1st) – Minister of Highways and Road Development Kabir Hashim called on the Chief Prelates of the Asgiri and Malwatu chapters today. The vehicular traffic in the Kandy City was a topic that came up for discussion during the meetings.Most Venerable Thibbatuwawe Sri Sumangala Thero the Chief Prelate of the Malwatu Chapter stated that similar to the expressways being constructed roads leading to the rural villages must be built. The Chief Prelate went on to question whether there is no other way to repair roads that are in a dilapidated condition. the Thero exclaimed that the tar on the roads had not been renewed for 25 years.Minister of Highways and Road Development, Kabir Hashim replied to this stating that by the end of the year the Ministry will begin a broad program to renovate the rural roads. Ven. Sri Sumangla Thero commented on this regard stating that it’s been three years since they have been elected and there is no time left for a broad program to be established.Minister Kabir Hashim also called on the chief prelate of the of the Asgiri Chapter to discuss development that are planned for the Kandy City.

heading: Tenure of SriLankan Airlines PCOI extended
content: COLOMBO (News 1st) – The tenure of the Presidential Commission of Inquiry (PCOI) appointed to investigate irregularities at SriLankan Airlines, Mihin Lanka & SriLankan catering was extended by five months.THE SHARE ANOMALYA serious anomaly in the registration of shares purchased from Emirates was exposed at the Presidential Commission of Inquiry on Wednesday (August 1st). In 2006 the Government of Sri Lanka owned 51.05% of the shares of SriLankan Airlines, while Emirates-owned 43.63% and others owned 5.32%.However, in 2010 an understanding had been reached to sell the 43.63% shares of Emirates to the Government of Sri Lanka. This is evident in a letter addressed to Former Secretary of Finance Dr. P.B. Jayasundara from the Chairman of Emirates Sheikh Ahmed bin Saeed Al Maktoum.At the time the Government Valuation Department had determined that the Government-owned shares were valued at 450 Million US Dollars. It was said today that Former President Mahinda Rajapaksa as the Minister of Finance had produced a memorandum to the Cabinet on the 1st of June 2010 and it notes that approval was granted to Bank of Ceylon (BOC) to explore the possibility in purchasing the Emirates shares for 53 Million US Dollars.According to the documents, on the 20th of June 2010 – 22,451,516 shares owned by Emirates were transferred to BOC for 53 Million US Dollars. What is surprising is that as of 30th August 2010 when SriLankan registered the shares, BOC had 12,115,517 shares, People’s Bank 4,236,135 shares, National Savings Bank 4,236,135 shares, and the EPF had 1,863,676 shares.However, there is no Cabinet Paper available to say that the Treasury approved the other state institutions to purchase the Emirates shares, despite the fact that the Cabinet only approved Bank of Ceylon to purchase the shares.SECURITY VIOLATION?Titus Kannangara the Senior Manager Security and Investigations at SriLankan Airlines Ltd. testifying today said it took the national carrier almost two and a half years to install an X-Ray scanning system at the Katunayake Airport.He said the original tender was canceled in 2014 citing an alleged security threat from the LTTE and the three X-Ray devices were only installed at the airport in 2016 & 2017. The airline had entered into individual 07-year service agreements with the supplier for Explosive Trace Detectors (ETD) and all of them were signed on the 31st of August 2016 by Major General ( Rtd.) P. Chandrawansa, the Head of Group Security.The ETDs were installed at the airport on the 15th of August 2016, two weeks before the service agreement was even signed. What should be noted is that the contract review form, which is a document signed by other user departments vetting the procurement, had been signed on the 18th of May 2016.The issue highlighted by the Attorney Generals Department is that the user departments had approved the procurement even before the ETDs were shipped to Sri Lanka.Titus Kannangara also confirmed that the HR Department at SriLankan Airlines requested him to release on 07 security personnel attached to the Sri Lanka Nidahas Sevaka Sangamaya, who were on duty, for election campaigning in Pelmadulla on the 27th of December 2014, for the political party that was in power at the time.The Collective bargaining agreement between the trade union and SriLankan Airlines clearly notes personnel cannot be released for any political activity.

heading: Duty on vehicles below 1000 CC increased
content: COLOMBO (News 1st) – The duty on vehicles with an engine capacity below 1000cc has been increased. The duty on non-hybrid vehicles with an engine capacity lower than 1000cc will be Rs 1.5 million. The duty on a hybrid vehicle with an engine capacity lower than 1000cc will be Rs 1.25 million.The increased duty will not be applicable for vehicles imported based on letters of credit(LC) established on or before August 1st 2018 and cleared from Sri Lanka Customs on or before the 31st January 2019.Revision of Vehicle pricesSampath Merinchige, President of the Sri Lanka Vehicle Importers’ Association states that popular Japanese cars in Sri Lanka like the Wagon R , Hustler and Spacia will see a price increase of around Rs. 315,000. Further, Petrol cars such as the Alto, the Nissan Dayz and the Honda N Box with an engine capacity of 660cc will see a price increase of Rs. 275,000.He goes on to state that the Government must have reached a decision on revising the prices due to an anomaly in the previous budget. He further added that when the previous budget was prepared the duty for a Wagon R dropped to Rs. 835,000 rupees from over Rs. 1.3 million. Sampath Merinchige stated that there needs to be discussion between the traders, customs and the Ministry as the government lost a certain amount of revenue from the wrong decisions taken previously.2015 Election PromisesIn a television commercial aired during the General Elections in 2015, Minister Kabir Hashim stated that they opened the corridor of supply to meet the demands of vehicles. The number of smaller cars in the country increased rapidly during that time and this resulted in congestion on the streets, stated the Minister. He further states that since the demand was met, the Ministry must have decided to make certain changes. It was stated then, that the policies will be subject to change and that it will depend on the supply and the demand.

heading: Special High Court summons Gamini Senarath
content: COLOMBO (News 1st) – The three-member Special High Court issued notices today (August 01) on 04 people including the Former President’s Chief of Staff Gamini Senarath to appear before court on the 24th of this month.The suspects have been indicted on 24 charges including the criminal misappropriation of Rs. 500mn from Litro Gas Lanka Limited.This is the first case filed before the three-member Special High Court by the Attorney General.The Attorney General had filed the case against the four respondents, Gamini Senarath, Piyadasa Kudabalgae, Neil Bandara Hapuhinna and K. Lasantha Bandara under the Public Property Act and the Penal Code. The Attorney General had informed the court that, 63 witnesses and 92 documents will be presented before the court to prove the charges against the suspects.

heading: Excise tax on cigarettes increased
content: COLOMBO (News 1st) – The Ministry of Finance has increased the excise tax imposed on cigarettes by Rs. 3.80 with effect from midnight yesterday (July 31).Thereby the selling price of a cigarette has increased by Rs 5.This means that the Cigarettes which were earlier priced at Rs 50 will now be sold at Rs. 55 while cigarettes priced at Rs. 55 will now be sold at Rs 60.

heading: Child dies after being strangled on a swing
content: COLOMBO (News 1st) – An unfortunate incident of a child losing his life was reported in Mulangawil, Kilinochchi.Gajendran Thuwaragan the eldest of four siblings had gone to play with his sister after returning home from school yesterday (July 31) when the rope of the swing he was playing on had wrapped around his neck result in death.“My son went to play, when I went to see him his eyes had gone up, I took him to the hospital right away. He was playing after he came home from school” said the Gajendran’s mother.

heading: 4053 graduates to be recruited for govt. training
content: COLOMBO (News 1st) – A spokesperson for the Ministry of National Policy and Economic Affairs said on the 20th of August, 4053 graduates will be recruited for training in the public sector as per the cabinet approval.Additional Secretary of the Ministry Asanka Dayaratne noted that these individuals have graduated from internal universities in Sri Lanka.Under this initiative, another 15,000 will be recruited for training in the public sector before the year-end.The Additional Secretariat added that these recruits will be made permanent employees in government agencies at the end of the one year training period.However, the Unemployed Graduates’ Union has shown their disagreement with regard to the decision as it prioritizes the internal graduates.

heading: Shootout in Wellawatte; 1 injured
content: COLOMBO (News 1st) – A suspected heroin smuggler has been injured in a shootout in Wellawatte.The suspect, 39-year-old Kamal Hettiarachchi was parked in front of a hotel on Charlemont road when police approached him in an SUV and three-wheeler. As police reached Hettiarachchi’s vehicle, he had attempted to speed off. Hettiarachchi in his attempt to flee had hit a police constable who has sustained injuries and crashed into a wall. Subsequently, police had shot Hettiarachchi who is now receiving treatment at the Nation Hospital.Kamal Hettiarachchi is resident of Olaboduwa in Gonapola.

heading: 180 government projects launched
content: COLOMBO (News 1st) – 180 projects apart of the Polonnaruwa development programme was vested with the public under the auspices of President Maithripala Sirisena.The ceremony, which will see 180 projects vested in the public will go on for a period of 3 days commencing from today (August 01).A new building for the Divulankadawala Central College in Medirigiriya was handed over to the students today (August 01).Addressing those gathered the President stated that every district has been divided to ensure balanced development and that we don’t look into our parents’ wellbeing enough.“We must make sure that our children are safe as they use mobile phones” continued the President.

heading: Investigations underway to track leopard killer
content: COLOMBO (News 1st) – Minister of Sustainable Development, Wildlife and Regional Development Field Marshal Sarath Fonseka stated that investigations are ongoing into the discovery of the carcasses of two Sri Lankan Leopards from the Nilgala Forest Reserve in Bibila last evening. (August 01)The Minister stated that a complaint has been lodged with the police in order to apprehend any suspects connected to the incident due to the lack of resources available for the wildlife officers to track them.Assistant Director of Wild Life of the Southern and Uva provinces Prasanna Wimaladasa stated that a post-mortem examination conducted last night revealed that that the carcasses were that of a pair of one and half-year-old leopards.The assistant director also added that information will be presented to the Bibile Magistrates Court today. (August 01)

heading: Wildfire wreaks havoc damaging forest reserves
content: COLOMBO (News 1st) – 15 acres of land has been destroyed due to a wildfire at the Wellawaya Kotaweheragala reserve.A spokesperson for the police stated that the wildfire had erupted in the evening yesterday (July 31). The fire had been doused by the collective efforts of the police, wildlife officials, and residents in the area.Another wildfire which erupted in the Anuradhapura, Malwathu Oya reserve had destroyed 10 acres.

heading: Secretary-General of Commonwealth arrives in SL
content: COLOMBO (News 1st) – Commonwealth Secretary-General Rt Hon Patricia Scotland QC arrived in the island today for a 4-day official visit.A spokesperson for the Foreign Affairs Ministry stated that this would be her first visit to Sri Lanka since she had assumed the Office of Secretary-General in April in the year 2016.The Commonwealth Secretary-General will meet with Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe, Minister of Foreign Affairs Tilak Marapana and other key ministers during the course of the day.The main objective of the Secretary-General’s meetings would be to explore greater cooperation and collaboration in the implementation of the agreed outcomes at the 2018 Commonwealth Heads of Government Meeting in London including promoting the Intra-Commonwealth trade.

heading: Your Wednesday Morning Brief
content: COLOMBO (News 1st) 1. Ceylon Bank Employees Union presented a written inquiry to the People’s Bank in order to clarify the procedure followed in granting a loan of Rs. 10bn to the MTD Walkers PLC. Executive Deputy Chairman of the MTD Walkers Jehan Amaratunge, for whom the loan was approved also serves as a Board member of the Peoples’ Bank.2.NZ immigration office located at Mumbai uncovered a scam carried out by a Sri Lankan based finance company that had forged visa documents for Sri Lankan college students aspiring to study in New Zealand. 88 such cases have been identified.3. Fort Magistrate Lanka Jayaratne re-issued a warrant against Sri Lanka’s ambassador to the United States Jaliya Wickremasuriya that had previously been convicted of a criminal misappropriation of US $ 132,000.4. The residents near the Gohagoda garbage dump is at risk of being prone to contaminated water.5.Carcasses of two Sri Lankan leopards have been recovered by the Wild Life officials dumped at the Nilgala Forest Reserve in Bibila yesterday. (July 31) The Zonal veterinarian For Uva and Central provinces suspect of the animals being poisoned to death.INTERNATIONAL1. NASA stated that Mars reached its closest approach to Earth yesterday  (July 31) with a distance of 35.8 million miles (57.6 million kilometers); a phenomenon witnessed after a period of 15 years.2.  As many as 85 people were injured on Tuesday (July 31), two critically, when an Aeromexico-operated Embraer passenger jet crashed soon after takeoff in Mexico’s state of Durango. SPORTS1. Indian captain Virat Kohli brushed off talk of having to prove his batting ability on English soil ahead of the five-match test series against the hosts starting at Edgbaston today (August 1).

heading: The ministerial connection behind the 10bn loan
content: Colombo (News1st) – On Monday details were revealed about a Rs. 10bn loan obtained from the People’s bank by a director of the bank for a private company which he is involved in. On Tuesday the Ceylon Bank Employees’ Union officially inquired from the People’s Bank on the Rs. 10bn loan.The Deshaya weekend newspaper reported on Sunday that the Rs. 10bn loan was granted to a company affiliated with the Director of People’s Bank. Upon further investigations conducted by News 1st, it was revealed that the loan was approved by the Loans Committee of People’s Bank where Jehan Amaratunge is a Board Member, for MTD Walkers PLC, where he holds the position of Executive Deputy Chairman,.General Secretary of the Ceylon Bank Employees’ Union, Ranjan Senanayake speaking to News1st explained that they had made a written inquiry to the administration of the People’s Bank to ascertain whether the necessary procedures were followed in issuing this loan.OFFICIAL EXPLANATIONIssuing a release on Tuesday to make clarifications on the matter, Chairman of People’s Bank Hemasiri Fernando said MTD Walkers PLC have had trusted dealings with the People’s Bank since 2004, adding the repayments for the constant financial lendings it granted were carried out in a proper and systematic manner. The People’s Bank Chairman points out the loan facility was awarded in adherence to the regulations of the Central Bank of Sri Lanka.Hemasiri Fernando’s release says the loan was granted with the approval of the Board of Directors in accordance with the recommendations of the Board’s Loans Committee which comprises of three members of the bank’s Board of Directors and Senior Officials of the Loan Board. The People’s Bank Chairman goes on to note the Board of Directors approved the loan only after ensuring that all requirements of the Central Bank were met.Hemasiri Fernando had stressed that when granting loan facilities, the People’s Bank only takes into account the proper procedure and not the recommendations or interferences of any other person or institution.Meanwhile, former People’s Bank Chairman Rusiripala Tennakoon says he has received reports that a Rs. 1bn loan granted to MTD Walkers PLC was classified as a non-performing loan on the 29th of July. He revealed that the People’s Bank had invested Rs. 500mn in MTD Walkers PLC debentures at an interest rate of 9.75%. Rusiripala Tennakoon says this is a considerably low-interest rate adding that a state bank making an investment at such a low-interest rate is questionable.As at the 31st of December 2015, People’s Bank was the 4th largest shareholder of MTD Walkers PLC. Niranjan Deva Aditya who is a close associate of the Prime Minister is also an Independent Non-Executive Director of this company.The leader of the National Unity Alliance, Azath Salley commenting on the matter noted that there is nothing the board of directors of the People’s bank could do as this incident was about Jehan Amaratunge who is a friend of Minister Malik Samarawickrama. Salley accused the Samarawickrama of using his influence to pass this loan through both the bank and the central bank.Déjà vuDo you remember how the Central Bank Treasury Bond Scam took place? It has now been proven that the father-in-law from with the Central Bank acted in a manner that benefited his son-in-law to the tune of billions of public funds.Isn’t it a conflict of interest when a Director of a State Bank approves a loan for another company he is affiliated with? What is the collateral the bank received when granting a loan of  Rs. 10bn?More details to follow.

heading: New Zealand uncovers Sri Lankan student visa scam
content: COLOMBO (News 1st) – Radio New Zealand made a revelation about a Sri Lankan visa scam involving hundreds of students studying in New Zealand.The report says the New Zealand immigration office in Mumbai that handles Sri Lankan applications received a tip-off at the beginning of this year. Officials inquiring into the incident concluded a Sri Lankan based finance company has been fraudulently creating documentation to help students meet the criteria of having $15,000 in the bank.New Zealand Immigration Minister Iain Lees-Galloway said officials did not yet know how many fraudulent applications may have slipped through the net. The Minister said the officials were going through 895 applications that came from Sri Lanka through the Mumbai office, to identify applications containing information from the “fraudulent” finance company.The Minister added the New Zealand government would not, however, be challenging any visas other than the original 88 when the fraud was discovered.According to the report, the New Zealand National Party wants to know why hundreds of past visas that have been granted to Sri Lankan students won’t be reviewed. The report says a number of New Zealand educational providers had been affected and were warned about the impact of student numbers in the future.

heading: Two Sri Lankan leopards poisoned
content: COLOMBO (News 1st) – Wildlife Officers recovered the carcasses of two Sri Lankan leopards from the Nilgala Forest Reserve in Bibila on Tuesday (July 31). They have been found together in an area known as Egodapitiya in the forest reserve.According to our correspondent, the discovery was made during a search after the Karadugala Police was tipped off.Zonal Veterinarian for the Uva and Central Provinces W.A.Dharmakeerthi suspect that the two animals may have been poisoned.Officials have also recovered the remains of a bull in close proximity to the carcasses of the leopards.

heading: Rajitha felicitated for his WHO appointment
content: COLOMBO (News 1st) – A ceremony was organized at the Nelum Pokuna Theatre to felicitate Health Minister (Dr.) Rajitha Senaratne, who was appointed as a Vice-President of the World Health Organization. The event was also graced by President Maithripala Sirisena.The event was organised by the Ministry of Health, Nutrition, and Indigenous Medicine together with the World Health Organization and Medical Trade Unions. Local representatives of the WHO and a number of local professionals also attended the event.Speaking at the event Professor Carlo Fonseka said the country has had 26 Ministers of health, the first one was S.W.R.D. Bandaranaike who resigned after a short period and soon became the leader of the nation, then Maithripala Sirisena resigned as Minister of Health and as President Bandaranaike he became the head of state in an unexpected manner. Fonseka wondered out loud whether Dr. Rajitha Senaratne would also do the same, sometime in the future.

heading: What is happening to the bond scam inquiry?
content: COLOMBO (News 1st) – Three years ago the Central Bank of Sri Lanka, under Governor Arjuna Mahendran, advertised a bond of Rs. 1 Billion for 30 years. Despite the passage of time, there is a remarkable absence of legal action being taken.Although the advertised amount was Rs. 1 Billion and the Public Debt Department recommended that an amount Rs. 2.06 Billion be taken up after the bids were received, then Governor Arjuna Mahendran acted in what turned out to be wrongful, improper, mala fide, fraudulent and in gross breach of his duties as Governor.The principal beneficiary of these deviant actions by the governor was a company named Perpetual Treasuries Limited which just happened to be owned and controlled by the family of his son in law Arjun Aloysius. After News 1st highlighted growing concerns of a conflict of interest and a departure from a procedure on the 16th of March 2015, Arjuna Mahendran admitted his liability on one aspect of this scam.In a telephone conversation with News1st, Mahendran admitted that he should have advertised for 10 billion rupees instead of one. The very next day (March 17th, 2015), Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe made a statement in Parliament. He said he insisted on a public auction because private placements had led to corruption and lack of transparency. In this statement, the Prime Minister as the Minister in charge of the Central Bank told Parliament that it was he who insisted on the change in the way that bonds be awarded.Thereafter the Prime Minister appointed a three-member Committee of UNP loyalists ( the Pitipana Committee) who had no knowledge of CBSL operations. Following the conclusion of this committee’s activities, COPE investigated the matter – where Mahendran admitted that he “only did as he was instructed to by the Prime Minister”. The Second COPE observed that Arjuna Mahendran was accountable for the loss.In the face of growing public concern and civil society calls President Sirisena appointed a Presidential Commission of inquiry headed by two Supreme Court Judges. 11 Months later, the Presidential Commission of Inquiry handed in its report to the President. This was in a backdrop of claims that Bond Report had found its way to a private residence prior to reaching the Presidential Palace and serious claims that a certain number of pages of this report are hidden or are being kept hidden.In a complete departure from process and procedure, President’s Secretary Austin Fernando decided to archive the entire report, ensuring that the report is kept away from public eyes for the next 30 years. Incidentally the first bond had its maturity date in 30 years.During the Presidential Commission’s proceedings, the Prime Minister was asked to appear as a witness and instead of a personal initial appearance he was sent a questionnaire and expected to reply in the form of an affidavit. When the Prime Minister did turn up at the commission, it was the Attorney General Jayantha Jayasuriya himself who questioned him, not individuals such as Yasantha Kodagoda or Dappula De Livera who had been thorough in their examination of other witnesses. The Attorney General’s questioning of the Prime Minister was met with strong criticism from the legal fraternity.Ministers Malik Samarawickrama and Kabir Hashim were questioned only for a few minutes and their questioning too attracted criticism.A SERIOUS ANOMALYPrime Minister Wickremesinghe on the 17th of March 2015 admitted he insisted on the change in the way the bonds are issued.  Arjuna Mahendran appearing before COPE stated he only followed the PMs instructions. Yet, the Bond Report does not address directly the PMs admission and Mahedran’s concurrence on the very subject.The Commission has recommended legal action against Arjuna Mahendran, several officials of CBSL, Arjun Aloysius and Kasun Palisena of PTL and several others.The Director General of the Bribery Commission Sarath Jayamanne has openly stated that the existing laws do not permit the commission to use the evidence from the Bond Commission in any prosecution. The proposed amendment to the laws has to be passed by Parliament where the matter has not even been given a debate thus far.It is remarkable that this entire exercise apart from being a conflict of interest scenario does not enjoy the serious attention of elected Parliamentarians to enable a change in the law and therefore the prosecution.All this is in a backdrop where the second bond issuance, seven times the amount of the first, remains uninvestigated.

heading: How clean is the water supplied to Kandy?
content: COLOMBO (News 1st) – Reports have surfaced that the water in the Mahaweli River is at risk of being contaminated due to the waste disposed at the Gohagoda Garbage Dump and surrounding areas. Area correspondent of News 1st stated that there is a very serious issue at present due to the threat of feces contaminating the water.The distance between the Gohagoda Garbage Dump and the Mahaweli River is roughly 50 meters. For over three decades garbage has been dumped at this site and at present, the garbage mountain is over 200 meters in height. It is at a location close to this Garbage Dump that the Kandy Municipal Council disposes of human waste as well.What is most surprising is that the Water Treatment Plant in Kandy obtains water from the Mahaweli River from a location which is just two meters away from the site where the human waste is disposed, the Gohagoda Garbage Dump is also located roughly one kilometer away from the Water Treatment Plant.Duty Engineer of the Polgolla Dam, Athula Pushpakumara he said they have not been informed of such an issue by the special field investigations unit. He added that when they come across such an issue or when a complaint is made they would discuss it with the Kandy Municipal Council and resolve the matter.If an immediate solution is not provided to the situation there will be serious environmental complications in the area.

heading: Accident on Anuradhapura-Puttlam road injures 10
content: COLOMBO (News 1st) – 10 people were seriously injured in a motor accident that took place at the 27th Mile Post area in Pahala Maragahawewa area along the Anuradhapura – Puttalam main road.The accident was a head-on collision between a Sri Lanka Army bus traveling from Jaffna and Kalpitiya and a van traveling from Colombo to Jaffna.A group of tourists traveling to Jaffna were inside the van at the time of the accident.The injured were immediately rushed to the Nochchiyagama Regional Hospital and eight of them who were in serious condition were transferred to the Anuradhapura Teaching Hospital. According to a Hospital Spokesperson, two of the victims were in critical condition.The Nochchiyagama Police arrested the driver of the Sri Lanka Army Bus and he is to be produced before the Thambuttegama Magistrates Court.

heading: Sri Lanka launches tourist-friendly Tuk Tuks
content: COLOMBO (News 1st) – Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe introduced Sri Lanka’s first ever tourist-friendly three-wheeler service in Colombo on Monday (July 30).The project was implemented by the Sri Lanka Tourism Development Authority (SLTDA) under the direction of the Minister of Finance and Mass Media Mangala Samaraweera.SLTDA has developed the basic curriculum for a two-day training course and test, after which the driver would receive a certification of completion, stickers and a photo identification card that must be displayed in the tuk-tuk.The certified tuk-tuk drives can display the seal on their three-wheeler allowing local and foreign tourists to easily identified the trained drivers and obtain their services.Training and educating three-wheeler drivers will no doubt help increase their individual incomes and the local economy of the community while providing safer and more organized travel choices for tourists.

heading: Warrant re-issued for the arrest of Jaliya
content: COLOMBO (News 1st) – A warrant has been re-issued by the Fort Magistrate Lanka Jayaratne for the arrest of the Former Ambassador to the United States of America, Jaliya Wickremesuriya.The Magistrate once again issued warrants for the arrest of Jaliya Wickremesuriya’s wife and relative who signed for his bail application. Fort Magistrate Lanka Jayaratne issued the order after considering the request made by the Police Financial Crimes Investigation Division.Sri Lanka’s former Ambassador to the United States Wickramasuriya has been charged with criminal misappropriation of 132,000 USD during his tenure as the ambassador. Wickramasuriya, who was arrested earlier on charges of theft, left the country for treatment after obtaining bail from the High Court.The verdict on the request made by the investigating officers to confiscate the property placed as bonds for his overseas travels will be made on the 27th of next month.

heading: Imbulpe fire continues to rage
content: COLOMBO (News 1st) – The fire reported on the Paraviyangala mountain in the Imbulpe, Balangoda has not been doused as yet.Our reporters state that the fire, which began on Sunday, (July 29) had continued to spread into the Namperial Reserve. Even though locals and students of the Sabaragamuwa university worked to control the fire on Sunday, strong winds and a dry climate aided in the fire spreading.Balangoda wildlife officials had entered the mountain’s reserve to inspect the damages caused due to the inferno. Over 60 acres of land has been consumed by the fire at present.

heading: Government stops importing eggs
content: COLOMBO (News 1st) – The Government has decided to stop the importing of eggs into the country.Minister of Fisheries & Aquatic Resources Development and Rural Economic Affairs Gamini Wijith Wijayamuni Zoysa stated that this decision had been taken after considering the issues faced by the local suppliers of eggs.The Minister added that the local producers currently face losses due to eggs being imported.

heading: Officer arrested for accepting Rs 1000 bribe
content: State Labourers’ Union on strikeCOLOMBO (News 1st) – The State Labourers’ union has decided to refrain from participating in the functions of the Labour Tribunals as an act of protest.President of the State Labourers’ Union Iresh Chinthaka stated that the strike has been in effect from midnight yesterday. (July 30)The union has chosen to strike as two of their officers from the Nuwara Eliya and the Kalmunei Labour Commissions have been arrested by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption.SSP Priyantha Chandrasiri stated that the two suspects had been arrested for accepting a bribe from a doctor from Nanu Oya. The bribe was a payment for the testimony of the two officers in a case being heard at the Labour Tribunal of Nuwara Eliya.The arrested officers of the Nuwara Eliya Labour Commission and the Kalmunei Labour Commission had accepted bribes of Rs. 1000 and Rs. 8000 respectively.

heading: Ban on extra classes for A/L from midnight today
content: COLOMBO (News 1st) – All seminars and extra classes in relation to the GCE A/L examination are to be prohibited from midnight, tonight. (July 31)The Commissioner of Examinations, Sanath B Pujitha stated that strict legal action will be taken against all those who violate this ban.The examination will start on the 6th of August and end on the 1st of September. This year 321,469 students are set to sit for the examinations across 2267 exam centers.

heading: Suspects of Welikada prison riot further remanded
content: COLOMBO (News 1st) – IP Neyomal Rangajeewa and the Former Commissioner of Prisons Emil Ranjan Lamahewa have been further remanded until the 7th of next month.The order was issued when the suspects were produced before Colombo additional magistrate Priyantha Liyanage.The suspects, Neyomal Rangajeewa and Emil Ranjan Lamahewa have been remanded in connection to the deaths of 27 inmates of the Welikada Prison during the 2012 Welikada Prison riots.

heading: PCOI term extended to investigate SriLankan
content: COLOMBO (News 1st) – The term of the Presidential Commission of Inquiry appointed to investigate irregularities at Sri Lankan Airlines, Mihin Lanka, and Sri Lankan Catering has been extended by 5 months.The Secretary to the Commission Ariyadasa Cooray said that its’ term was due to end tomorrow (August 2).A gazette notification has been issued extending its term up to the 31st of December 2018, on the orders of the President. Ariyadasa Cooray stated that the hearing of evidence at the commission is due to take place today.President Maithripala Sirisena appointed the commission to investigate irregularities at Sri Lankan Airlines, Mihin Lanka and Sri Lankan Catering on the 14th of February this year.Retired Supreme Court Judge – Anil Gunarathne has been appointed as the Chairman of the Commission, while the other members are, Court of Appeal Judge – E.A.G.R. Amarasekara, Retired Supreme Court Judge – Piyasena Ranasinghe, Retired Auditor General – M.D.A. Harrol and Director General of the Sri Lanka Accounting and Auditing Standards Monitoring Board – W.J.K. Geeganage.

heading: University protests receive outside funding
content: Colombo (News1st) – Minister of Higher Education Wijeyadasa Rajapaksa claims that University Students are being funded by external parties to carry out political activities and create political crises.Addressing a media briefing in Colomb Yesterday Minister Rajapaksa claimed that people do not think of education when they think about Sri Lanka’s university system, instead, they think of protests and demonstrations. The Minister claimed that most of the students’ organisations spent a majority of their time over the past 2 years on the road due to the issued that had about SAITM.Rajapaksa stated that they will strictly implement the law with regards to ragging and explained that even tribes in Africa do not engage in harmful behaviour of this nature. He added that there are gangs that have formed in the Universities and that they operate safehouses for their activities.The Minister of Higher Education noted that students are being funded by external parties and that the ministry would reveal everything as soon as they gather enough proof.  Min. Wijeyadasa claimed that there is no point in students setting up huts and engaging in fasts without informing the ministry of what they required, he believes that this shows that they want to create an issue and not actually resolve issues that they face.The Inter University Students’ Federation (IUSF) also convened a media briefing yesterday to counter the views expressed by the Minister of Higher Education. Convenor of the IUSF Lahiru Weerasekara speaking at the occasion noted that everything that was expressed by the Minister of Higher Education was opinions and decisions reached with the vice-chancellors of the university who are puppets for the administration. The IUSF also challenged the Minister to reveal details of their alleged backers.

heading: Vehicle duty increased
content: COLOMBO (News 1st) – The duty on vehicles with an engine capacity below 1000cc has been increased. The duty on non-hybrid vehicles with an engine capacity lower than 1000cc will be Rs 1.5 million.The duty on a hybrid vehicle with an engine capacity lower than 1000cc will be Rs 1.25 million.The increased duty will not be applicable for vehicles imported based on letters of credit(LC) established on or before August 1st 2018 and cleared from Sri Lanka Customs on or before the 31st January 2019.

heading: Excise tax on cigarettes increased by Rs. 3.80
content: COLOMBO (News 1st) – The Ministry of Finance has increased the excise tax imposed on cigarettes by Rs. 3.80 with effect from midnight yesterday (July 31).

heading: Commonweal Secretary-general to visit
content: COLOMBO (News 1st) – Commonwealth Secretary-General Patricia Scotland Queens Counsel will arrive in the island for a 4-day official visit today (August 01).A spokesperson for the Foreign Affairs Ministry stated that this would be her first visit to Sri Lanka since she had assumed Office of Secretary-General in April in the year 2016.The Commonwealth Secretary-General will meet with Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe, Minister of Foreign Affairs Tilak Marapana and other key ministers during the course of the day.The main objective of the Secretary-General’s meetings would be to explore greater cooperation and collaboration in the implementation of the agreed outcomes at the 2018 Commonwealth Heads of Government Meeting in London including promoting the Intra-Commonwealth trade.

heading: Rope of swing throttles child to death
content: COLOMBO (News 1st) – An unfortunate incident of a child losing his life was reported in Mulangawil, Kilinochchi.Gajendran Thuwaragan the eldest of four siblings had gone to play with his sister after returning home from school yesterday (July 31) when the rope of the swing he was playing on had wrapped around his neck result in death.“My son went to play, when I went to see him his eyes had gone up, I took him to the hospital right away. He was playing after he came home from school” said the Gajendran’s mother.

heading: Thunderstorms predicted across the island
content: COLOMBO (News 1st) – A spokesperson for the Meteorology Department stated that showers and possibly thunderstorms will occur in the Western, Central, Sabaragamuwa and North-western provinces and in the Galle and Matara districts.He added light showers may occur in Anuradhapura and Vavuniya districts while showers or thunderstorms will be scattered across the Uva province, Batticaloa and Ampara districts after 2.00 p.m.Strong winds up to 40-50 kmph can be expected in the Hambantota, Monaragala, Ampara Matale, Polonnaruwa, Anuradhapura, Puttalam and Mannar districts.50 mm rainfall is predicted across the Central and Sabaragamuwa provinces, Kaluthara, Galle and Matara districts.

heading: Your Tuesday Morning Brief
content: COLOMBO (News 1st)1. A Chinese national; an employee of the China State Engineering Corporation has been arrested on the suspicion of attempting to bribe an official of the Mahaweli Authority’s Agunkuolapelessa Regional office with a sum of Rs. 20,000.2. Rs. 10 billion loan has been granted by the Peoples Bank to the Executive President of CML Walkers Jehan Amaratunga. He also serves as a director of Peoples Bank which raises concerns of impropriety and conflicts of interest.3. JVP Leader Anura Kumara Dissanayake accused Prime Minister Ranil Wickremasinghe of being directly involved in the bond scam, which resulted in the largest case of corruption in Sri Lanka’s history.4. Thusitha Halloluwa, Chief of Staff to the Finance and Media Minister evades a complaint lodged by journalist Ushantha Warnakumara regarding the threats made by the former to the latter.5. All support seminars and extra classes in relation to the G.C.E A/L examination will be restricted with effect from midnight today. (July 31)INTERNATIONAL 1. Jailed, former Pakistani Prime Minister Nawaz Shariff taken to hospital in Islamabad for a possible heart condition.2. China making a move to loosen restrictions imposed on foreign investments enabled more foreign companies to perform trade and also as a mode of domestic upliftment took to reform the farming industry.SPORTS 1. Former Director of Conservation of the Department of Archaeology, Gamini Wijesuriya denies rumors of UNESCO recommendation to remove constructions at the Galle International Cricket Stadium.

heading: 3 arrested for possession of Kush
content: COLOMBO (News 1st) – Three people have been arrested by the Police Special Task Force in Colombo for the possession of the drug Kush which is a strain of Cannabis Indica.A spokesperson for the Police STF stated that the arrest had been made on a tip-off that was received at noon yesterday. (July 30)Eight grams of Kush that was found in the possession of the suspects has been sent to the Police Narcotics Bureau for investigation purposes.The spokesperson added that the suspects were arrested in Horton Place and Welikada. This drug is predominantly used by the upper echelon of society.

heading: Water cut at 9 am in Biyagama North
content: COLOMBO (News 1st) – A water cut is scheduled for 9 am today (July 31) which will be in effect in Biyagama north and surrounding suburbs.A spokesperson for the National Water Supply and Drainage Board said that the interruption will be in effect for 15 hours.The water cut will be in effect to allow mandatory maintenance work on the distribution system which supplies water to the Biyagama Free Trade Zone.The Grama Niladhari divisions of Siyambalapewatta, Alubowila, Delgoda, Akurumulla, Kanduboda, Ulahitiwala, Walgama, Yabaraluwa, Malwana, Dompe, Naamaluwa, Dekatana, Narampala and Galwalaboda will be affected due to the interruption in water supply.

heading: Bribery attempt goes wrong for Chinese national
content: COLOMBO (News 1st) – A Chinese national has been arrested by Police on suspicion of attempting to bribe an official. The arrest was made based on a complaint lodged by an official of the Mahaweli Authority’s Angunakolapelessa Regional Office.According to the Police Media Spokesperson’s office, the Chinese national an employee of the China State Construction Engineering Corporation had arrived at the Regional Office to extend the gunpowder license for the ‘B Section’ of the Galwala Project. The Police received a telephone call claiming the Chinese national had attempted to pay a bribe of Rs. 20,000 to the Mahaweli Office Manager to get the task done.China State Construction Engineering Corporation supplies rocks for the Matara – Hambantota Expressway.The Chinese national was produced in court after being questioned by Police. The Angunakolapelessa Magistrates Court ordered the suspect to be remanded until tomorrow (July 31) and to be produced before the Colombo Chief Magistrates Court.The Chinese ConnectionIn the Chinese mainland, Lu Wei, the Former Deputy Head of Publicity Department of the Communist Party, was prosecuted today (July 30) on charges of bribery. According to foreign media reports, the 58-year-old took advantage of various posts to seek benefits for others and accepted a large number of bribes.This scenario follows a recent execution of two former vice-mayors in eastern China, who were convicted of bribery. The Supreme People’s Court published a statement on its website, saying Xu Maiyong and Jiang Renjie had been sentenced to death and were executed in Beijing.Xu was convicted of bribery, embezzlement and abuse of power during his time as vice-mayor of the wealthy resort city of Hangzhou, west of Shanghai. Jiang was sentenced to death by the Intermediate People’s Court of Nanjing city in April 2008.

heading: State bank prepares to dole out Rs 10bn loan
content: Colombo (News1st) – The Deshaya newspaper reports that a Director of a State Bank who also holds positions at several affiliated financial institutions, has obtained a loan of 10 billion rupees from the State Bank for his private institutions.According to the report the loan is said to be the largest loan ever granted since the inception of this State Bank 65 years ago. The report adds that the loan facility has been approved at multiple stages and had also received the approval of the bank’s board of directors and loans committee.When the Deshaya newspaper had made inquiries from the Chairman of the State Bank, he had confirmed the report of the loan adding that the loan had gone through the proper channels. The state bank chairman was also questioned on whether there was no conflict of interests, given the connections between the director and the group of companies that had been granted the loan, however, he had said that he could not respond.Inquiries made by News 1st revealed that the loan of 10 billion rupees had been made to CML Walkers, a construction contractor by the state-owned People’s Bank. Responding to inquiries made by News 1st, the Chairman of the Large Scale Loan Board at People’s Bank, Dr. Aminda Methsila noted that the Bank had already loaned about 50 billion rupees to this company as at 2014.He noted that the company had repaid this loan. Dr. Methsila added that accordingly, loans could be issued to the company in question, with a credit limit of 50 billion rupees.According to the 106/2017 Annual Report of CML Walkers, Jehan Amaratunge is the Executive Vice President of the Group. He is also a member of the Board of Directors of People’s Bank and has served in that position since 2010.The Chairman of the Bank at the time of Amaratunge’s appointment was Gamini Senarath.The company CML Walkers has been awarded contracts for the construction of many government projects including roads and bridges – among these is the contract for the construction of a section of stage 2 of the Central Expressway.Is it fair for an individual who serves as a director of a state bank to obtain a 10 billion rupee loan from that bank to benefit his private businesses? Is it legal?This state bank holds the money of the people of this country? Is it not their duty to properly manage this money and ensure that the people reap the benefits?Was the proper procedure followed when approving the loan of 10 billion rupees from a state bank?News 1st is keeping watch.More information on this will be divulged in the near future.

heading: Halolluwa 'no show' for police investigation
content: COLOMBO (News 1st) – Thusitha Halloluwa is a Chief of Staff at a Ministry, and also a director of a key Government office. Halloluwa was summoned to the Kadawatha Police today (July 30) in connection to allegedly threatening a journalist. However, he did not arrive at the police station for the investigation.Journalist Ushantha Warnakumara had lodged a complaint at the Kadawatha Police, claiming that Thusitha Halloluwa threatened him when he raised questions regarding a multi-million rupee deal.Speaking to the media, journalist Warnakumara said that though he arrived at police for the preliminary investigation at 2 pm, the “relevant person” (Halloluwa) did not arrive.“This threat can be considered as a threat to the media. He used his personal mobile phone to threaten me. I have the relevant recordings and I have produced them for the legal actions.” said Journalist Ushantha Warnakumara.

heading: Anura slams both sides of the isle on Corruption
content: COLOMBO (News 1st) – MP Anura Kumara Dissanayake, leader of the JVP stats that former President Mahinda Rajapaksa is yet to reject the claim that he recieved US$ 7.6 Million (Rs. 1.1 Billion) from a Chinese company.“Last week all the details, about the number of cheques, how they were transferred to the banks and who transferred them were revealed in Parliament. It wouldn’t have mattered to us if a Chinese company gave this money to Mahinda of Medamulana. But instead, it was given to President Mahinda.”, he added.The JVP leader also spoke about the companies in question.“One constructed a port, another an airport, another built Norochcholai and the other built the South Container Terminal of the Colombo Port. So isn’t this a good reason enough for us to assume that these were constructed solely for the purpose of getting money? Or else what other interests does China have to pay money to a Sri Lankan President?” Anura Kumara questioned.The Parliamentarian then set his sights on  Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe, saying that no one can hide the fact that “Ranil Wickremesinghe is involved in the bond scam”.He also recalled questioning the PM in parliament on the bond scam, few weeks after the incident. “He denied, saying nothing like that happened, which instantly proved that it did. So the man (Arjuna Mahendran) scooted off to Singapore. It was Ranil who protected him after the theft and it was Ranil who helped him flee the country as well. So does this not make him the person behind the theft? What other proof do you need? This kind of evidence is not detrimental to a case. There is something called circumstantial evidence based on which the court can make a decision. Which is why I say Ranil is directly involved in this deal..”It is well known that the bond scam caused monumental losses to Sri Lanka. It is the largest incident of defrauding state funds in the political history of the country. Through parliament, civil society, the Committee on Public Enterprises and the report of the Presidential Commission of Inquiry, the manner in which this crime was carried out and the perpetrators, were exposed.While this is the major topic of conversation on the political stage, on whose interference is the recovery of these funds and the punishment of the perpetrators being delayed continuously?The people do not want to listen to stories anymore – they want the perpetrators to be punished.The people are watching.

heading: Midnight train strike called off
content: COLOMBO (News 1st) – The train strike that was scheduled to be launched at midnight (July 30) has been called off.President of the Railway Station Masters Association Janaka Fernando stated that the strike was called off following discussions with Minister (Dr.) Sarath Amunugama.The train strike was organized by the railway supervisors, controllers and drivers to protest against salary anomalies.

heading: Over 60 acres destroyed by Imbulpe wild fire
content: COLOMBO (News 1st) – The fire that erupted on the Parawiyangala mountain in Imbulpe, Balangoda is continuing to spread according to the Divisional Secretary of Imbulpe.He said that attempts to control the fire since last night (July 29) have been unsuccessful and that over 60 acres had already been destroyed by the fire.The Divisional secretary said that six suspects have been arrested on charges of beginning the fire.The Parawiyangala mountain in Imbulpe is known as “Adara Kanda” among the university students of Sri Lanka.

heading: Chilaw-Colombo bus strike continues
content: COLOMBO (News 1st) – The strike action launched by private bus employees of buses plying along the Chilaw – Colombo route continued for a 4th day today. (July 30)Our correspondent in the area noted that other bus operators have also joined this strike action. Both regular and AC buses operating on the Puttlam – Colombo route, as well as buses operating on the Anamaduwa – Colombo and Negombo – Chilawroute have joined the strike action.The strike was launched on the 26th of this month after a driver on a Chilaw – Colombo bus was assaulted in Colombo. The driver was hospitalised due to the nature of his injuries.The bus operators are engaged in a strike calling on the police to take action. However, the police noted that an investigation has been launched into the incident by a number of police stations including the Chilaw, and Madampe police stations.

heading: One dead following an altercation in Kiribathgoda
content: COLOMBO (News 1st) – One person was stabbed to death during a musical show in Dingidiyawatta Kiribathgoda.According to a spokesperson for the police, an altercation between two groups had resulted in the murder this morning. (July 30)The Victim was a 22-year-old resident of Kadawatha.The spokesperson added that one suspect has been arrested in connection to the incident.

heading: 2 heroin smugglers sentenced to death
content: Colombo (News1st) : 2 suspects convicted of Heroin smuggling charges were sentenced to death today (July 30th) by the Colombo High Court.The verdict was delivered by Colombo High Court Judge Gihan Kulatunge.The two suspects were residents of Maligakanda. They were arrested by the Police Narcotics Bureau on the 23rd of January 2013 in Horton Place, Colombo with 60g of Heroin.

heading: Don't fly kites around airports - CAA
content: COLOMBO (News 1st) – Its kite season in Sri Lanka and this has created some new issued for the Civil Aviation Authority (CAA) of Sri Lanka. The CAA issuing a media release has called on the general public to take precautions when flying Kites in and around airfieldsThe CAA warns that flying kites within 5km of an airfield is illegal and is a punishable offence.The release added, the public must not send anything above 300 feet in the air as it may pose a safety hazard for oncoming aircraft as such objects can easily be ingested by aircraft engines or become entangled in aircraft propellers, resulting in engine failures.

heading: Ingiriya Police OIC interdicted
content: Colombo (News1st) : The OIC of the Ingiriya police has been interdicted with immediate effect based on the instructions of the Inspector general of Police (IGP).Police Media Spokesperson SP Ruwan Gunasekara noted that the order was issued in consultation with the National Police Commission.The three police officers who were placed in remand custody on charges of illegally arresting 2 individuals have also been interdicted. The three police officers face charges of illegally arresting an army soldier and a disabled individual in Ingiriya.Investigations into the incident are being spearheaded by the Superintendent of Police in charge of the Panadura police division.

heading: Protesters block Sooriyawewa Divisional Sec.
content: COLOMBO (News 1st) – A group staged a demonstration obstructing the entrance to the Sooriyawewa divisional secretary in Hambanthota this morning. (July 30)The protest was staged by area residents who had not received compensation for the lands that they had given up during the expansion of the “100-foot road” in Sooriyawewa, Hambantota. It has been 45 days since demonstrations began. The protestors demand that compensation be provided to them as soon as possible.One demonstrator said: “We held constant demonstrations. And everytime we did, they came and made false promises. They only deceived us without giving us proper answers.”The Assistant Superintendent of Police for Hambantota who arrived at the location notified the protesters to move from the road. The protestors were obstructing the Sooriyawewa – Embilipitiya road during the demonstration.Police later took measures to disperse the protestors.

heading: STF recovers 35kg of Kerala Ganja
content: Colombo (News1st) – Nine persons were arrested for the possession of Kerala Ganja, following islandwide raids conducted by the Police Special Task Force.The suspects had been arrested from the Weyangoda, Puliyankulama, Wellawatte and Borelesgamuwa areas.The STF had recovered a total of 35kg of Kerala Ganja through the raids. The 9 suspects are due to be produced before the court today.

heading: CEB and PUCSL Chairpersons summoned before COPE
content: COLOMBO (News 1st) – The chairpersons of the Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) and the Public Utilities Commission (PUCSL) has been summoned before COPE for a discussion set to take place on the 7th of August.President of COPE, MP Sunil Handunetti stated that they are being summoned to discuss steps followed in purchasing power from private power plants and in setting the price for each unit of electricity.
